Know(Event).description: Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer adding some Phenomenon to their model of the world. They are similar to Coming-to-believe words, except the latter generally involve reasoning from Evidence.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.frequency: This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often.
attributes.instrument: The Cognizer uses an Instrument to (enable themselves to) become aware of the Phenomenon.  In some cases, the Instrument may appear in subject position.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the Time when the Cognizer becomes aware of the Phenomenon.
attributes.period_of_iterations: This FE is minimally distinct from Duration and Duration_of final_state in that the clause described is conveyed to be iterative.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.
attributes.evidence: The Evidence is some fact that allows the Cognizer to become aware of something. It is normally expressed with PP-from:
attributes.cognizer: The Cognizer is the person who becomes aware of a Phenomenon. It is normally expressed as an External Argument.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.
attributes.degree: This FE identifies the Degree to which becoming aware is occurring.
attributes.purpose: The goal that the Cognizer has in mind, which they believe to be accomplishable by finding the Phenomenon.
attributes.manner: This FE identifes the Manner in which becoming aware occurs.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.
attributes.topic: Topic indicates the general field within which the Phenomenon is found.
attributes.state: The State indicates the state or situation of the Phenomenon at the time when the Cognizer becomes aware of it.  It is normally expressed by a Predicate expression (e.g. a PP or a participial VP):
attributes.phenomenon: Thm Phenomenon is the entity or situation in the world of which a Cognizer becomes aware. It is normally expressed as an Object:
attributes.ground: The Ground is the background or context against which a Cognizer becomes aware of a Phenomenon. It is normally expressed by a locative PP:
attributes.means: This FE identifes the Means by which the Cognizer becomes aware of the Phenomenon.

Warning(Event).description: A Speaker warns an Addressee by giving a Message that describes an undesirable situation that may affect the Addressee. The warning may alternatively be described as about Topic pertaining to the undesirable situation, or issued via a specific Medium.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.addressee: The Addressee receives the warning from the Speaker.
attributes.communicative_force: This FE indicates the Communicative_force or authority with which the Message is expressed (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.).
attributes.means: The Means describes the way the Speaker accomplishes the task of warning the Addressee.
attributes.manner: The Manner describes the way in which the Speaker delivers the warning.
attributes.descriptor: A characteristic or description of the telling event or of the Speaker or Addressee.
attributes.message: The Message is the communication produced by the Speaker.
attributes.iterations: This FE indicates the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.
attributes.medium: This frame element is the Medium in which the Message is expressed.
attributes.topic: The Topic is a general description of the content of the Message.
attributes.time: The time period during which the Speaker warns the Addressee.
attributes.speaker: The Speaker produces the Message to alert the Addressee as to possible danger.
attributes.place: The location in which the Speaker warns Addressee.

Catastrophe(Event).description: The words in this frame involve an Undesirable_event which affects the Patient negatively.  No agent need be involved.  The first calamity was a disastrous trade war with Holland.  It is sad to have to make a living by grubbing around in the dirt of a national calamity.  The result has been catastrophic.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.manner: Manner of performing an action
attributes.place: Where the Undesirable_Event takes place.
attributes.cause: The cause of the Undesirable_Event.
attributes.degree: This FE identifies the Degree to which event occurs.
attributes.time: When the Undesirable_Event occurs.
attributes.circumstances: This FE indicates the Circumstances under which a warning applies. (Proper only to betide.)
attributes.patient: The entity that experiences the Undesirable_Event.  An environmental disaster is just what we need. Should hair loss befall you...

Placing(Event).description: This frame represents the abstract scene in which an Agent manipulates a Theme's location, thus affecting a Goal which ends up co-located with the Theme.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.source: The Source is the initial location of the Theme, before it changes location.
attributes.time: The time at which the Theme is at the Location.
attributes.goal: The FE Goal is the location where the Theme ends up. This FE is profiled by words in this frame.
attributes.result: This FE identifies the Result of the Placing.
attributes.means: The Means is an act whereby the Agent achieves the placing of the Theme.
attributes.place: The location (generally presumed to be known to the interlocutor) with respect to which the location of the Theme can be understood.
attributes.cause: Grass , which is sown with clover , provides rich pasture for cattle in summer and the clover is another plant which puts nitrogen into the soil .
attributes.explanation: The Explanation indicates why the Placing occurs.
attributes.subregion: The Subregion is the smaller area of the Goal where the filling or covering occurs. Mrs. Bouvier anointed the children with oil on the forehead.
attributes.agent: The Agent is the person (or other force) that causes the Theme to move.
attributes.theme: An entity which is at a particular Location
attributes.instrument: The Instrument with which the filling occurs.
attributes.depictive: A Depictive expression describes a state or condition of the Theme independent of its location.
attributes.degree: The Degree indicates the degree to which the placing occurs.
attributes.path: Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal expresses the frame element Path. In this frame, Path expressions almost always have a via-sense.
attributes.manner: Any expression which describes a property of the placing action which is not directly related to the trajectory of the Theme's motion expresses the frame element Manner. Descriptions of speed, steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as Manner expressions.
attributes.area: The Area is the setting into which the Theme is placed.
attributes.cotheme: This frame element is used to denote phrases that specifically entail an entity which is conceived as moving relative to another entity.
attributes.beneficiary: This extrathematic FE applies to participants that derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate. Further, the target predicate should involve some sort of Agent that intends that the benefit go to the Beneficiary.
attributes.distance: This FE is any expression which characterizes the extent of motion.
attributes.purpose: An action that the Agent intends to accomplish by perform the placing action.
attributes.duration: The Duration is the amount of time for which the Theme is to stay in the Goal location.
attributes.speed: The Speed is the rate at which Placing occurs.
attributes.dependent_state: A state (of the Theme) that results as a consequence of the Theme being situated at the Location.
attributes.location: A salient entity that the Theme is located with respect to.

Causation(Event).description: A Cause, animate or inanimate, causes a process, the Effect, to begin.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.
attributes.event_description: This FE applies to appraisals of the event, typically a judgment of its expectedness
attributes.medium: Medium is the physical or abstract setting in which the Cause results in the Effect.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.
attributes.communicative_force: This FE indicates the Communicative_force or authority with which the target operates (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.).
attributes.means: An action through which the Actor or Cause accomplishes the action indicated by the target.
attributes.cause: A force, process, or event that produces an effect.
attributes.manner: Any holistic description of the event, including overall depictions (the same way) and descriptions pertaining to the Actor's influence on the character of the event (eagerly, quietly).
attributes.place: Where the event takes place.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the Time when the event occurs.
attributes.containing_event: This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.
attributes.concessive: This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.
attributes.purpose: To what end the Cause caused the Effect.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.
attributes.new_situation: A consecutive event to the starting of the Effect.
attributes.effect: A positive or negative evaluation of the Phenomenon.
attributes.depictive: This FE identifies the  Depictive phrase describing the actor or undergoer of an action.
attributes.co-timed_event: This FE identifies the first Co-timed_event of the started Effect.
attributes.affected: Agents in a joint or reciprocal action (e.g. exchange)
attributes.actor: An entity which participates in a Cause, perhaps volitionally and perhaps not.
attributes.frequency: How often the action denoted by the target occurs.

Arriving(Event).description: A Visitor arrives at the Host_location as a guest of the Host, for the purpose of achieving a Purpose. The Purpose is often social in nature, i.e., the visit itself constitutes a goal.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.explanation: A state of affairs that explains why the Visitor is making a visit.
attributes.place: The place where the visiting occurs
attributes.frequency: How often the Theme arrives at the Goal.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the purpose for which the Agent arrives at the Goal.
attributes.manner: A Manner expression  describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion.  Descriptions of speed, steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as Manner expressions.
attributes.path: Path is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Normal_location nor a Goal.  In this frame, Path expressions almost always have a via-sense.
attributes.visitor: The Visitor goes to the Host
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by which an Agent arrives.
attributes.containing_event: The Containing_event denotes an event or state of affairs that occurs or holds at a time that includes the time during which the visiting takes place.
attributes.host: The Host welcomes the Visitor as a guest. The location strongly associated with the Host serves as the goal of the Visitor's motion.
attributes.duration: The length of time that the Visitor remains with the Host.
attributes.mode_of_transportation: The Mode_of_transportation expresses how the motion of the Agent is effected, by its body or by a vehicle which holds and conveys the Agent.   Vehicles can move in any way and in any medium. They are usually expressed obliquely with 'in' or 'by'.
attributes.normal_location: Normal_location is any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion. While Normal_location expressions are possible in this frame, they are relatively infrequent.  If present, they often express a general direction from which a Agent moves, rather than a landmark away from which it moves.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the Time when arriving occurs.
attributes.particular_iteration: This FE indicates that the visiting is a particular instance in a series of repeated visiting events.
attributes.host_location: The Host_location is a location associated with the Host, and is commonly the place of residence or employment of the Host.
attributes.goal: Goal is any expression that tells where the Agent ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion.  Although always conceptually present and specific, Goal may sometimes be understood from context, rather than expressed by any separate constituent.
attributes.agent: Agent is the object that moves under its own power.
attributes.useful_location: The place or thing that the Theme is headed towards, despite a potential or actual Barrier.
attributes.barrier: An entity that (at least potentially) prevents the Theme from getting to the Useful_location.
attributes.theme: Theme is the object that moves. It may be an entity that moves under its own power, but it need not be. The officer approached the house.I ducked as the baseball approached my head.
attributes.depictive: The Depictive is a phrase which describes the state of the Theme upon arrival. The Princess of Wales arrived smiling.
attributes.source: Source is any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion. While Source expressions are possible in this frame, they are relatively infrequent.  If present, they often express a general direction from which a Theme moves, rather than a landmark away from which it moves.The cat approached the bird from behind.She arrived from New York yesterday.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.
attributes.degree: This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.
attributes.re-encoding: This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action.
attributes.cotheme: Cotheme is the second moving object, expressed as a direct object or an oblique. Pat came  with me down the street.
attributes.event_description: This FE marks the state of affairs reported by the Arriving Event as understood to play a role in the state of affairs of the modifier.
attributes.period_of_iterations: The time period within which the arrival repeats multiple times.
attributes.new_situation: The New_situation are the state of the Goal when the Theme arrives.

Commerce_money-transfer(Event).description: The subframe of the Commercial_transaction frame which involves the transfer of Money from the Buyer to the Seller (in exchange for the Goods).

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.time: When the event occurs.
attributes.place: Where the event takes place.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation for which an event occurs.
attributes.money: Money is the thing given in exchange for Goods in a transaction.
attributes.rate: In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods.
attributes.manner: A description of the transfer not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly) and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of a Buyer, Seller, or Exchangers that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.unit: This FE is any unit in which goods or services can be measured.
attributes.means: The means by which a commercial transaction occurs.
attributes.exchangers: The Buyer and Seller considered jointly.
attributes.purpose: The state-of-affairs that the Buyer, Seller, or Exchangers wish to bring about by participating in the exchange.
attributes.goods: The FE Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction.
attributes.buyer: The Buyer wants the Goods and offers Money to a Seller in exchange for them.
attributes.seller: The Seller has possession of the Goods and exchanges them for Money from a Buyer.

Sending(Event).description: A Sender plans the Path (along with Source and Goal) of a Theme and places it in circumstances such that it travels along this Path under the power of some entity other than the Sender.  This frame also has a Recipient distinct from the Goal, as both can be present:

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.theme: The entity which has ended up in the possession of the Recipient
attributes.container: A container in which the Goods is delivered.
attributes.source: The location of the Goods before the delivery process begins.
attributes.recipient: The individual that has ended up with the Theme.
attributes.place: Where the event takes place.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation for which an event occurs.
attributes.sender: This is the person who initiates the movement of the Theme and, unlike Carrying, does not accompany it.
attributes.goal: The end of the path and intended goal of the sending.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the purpose for which a Theme is transferred
attributes.degree: Degree to which event occurs
attributes.depictive: The state of the Goods or the Deliverer during the action.
attributes.cotheme: An additional theme delivered along with the main Goods.
attributes.time: This FE indicates the Time when the Post_transfer event occurs.
attributes.distance: This FE is any expression characterizing the extent of motion of the Theme. Pat threw the Javelin 50 meters.
attributes.manner: The way that the Donor possesses the Theme.
attributes.path: The path along which the Goods move while being delivered.
attributes.circumstances: The conditions under which the delivery takes place.
attributes.period_of_iterations: The length of time from when the Delivery event began to be repeated to when it stopped.
attributes.means: The action whereby the transfer of the Theme from the Donor to the Recipient is effected.
attributes.speed: The Speed at which the Deliverer delivers the Goods.
attributes.vehicle: The vehicle employed by the Deliverer.
attributes.event_description: This FE applies to appraisals of the Delivery event.
attributes.beneficiary: The person for whom the Delivery action occurs.
attributes.deliverer: This is the person who completes the movement of the Goods after having transported it.
attributes.purchaser: The individual who purchases and receives the Goods.
attributes.donor: The individual that has just given the Theme away.
attributes.transferors: The Donor and Recipient conceived of as a unit.

Protest(Event).description: An Arguer presents a Content, along with Support, to an Addressee.  The Content may refer elliptically to a course of action or it may refer to a proposition that the Addressee is to believe.  Some lexical units (e.g. "prove") indicate the speaker's belief about the Content.Jan argued that the evidence was inadmissable.Jan argued against the admissability of the evidence.Jan proved  that the evidence was inadmissable.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.result: This FE identifies the Result of an arguing event.
attributes.manner: This FE identifes the Manner in which an Arguer argues.Jan argued convincingly that the evidence was inadmissable.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the location where an argument is made by an Arguer.
attributes.depictive: Depictive identifies a phrase describing a participant in an action.Jan argued that the evidence was inadmissable in a tuxedo.
attributes.support: Support lends epistemic support to a claim, or provides a reason for a course of action.Jan argued that gun was inadmissable as evidence because the police didn't have a search warrant.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by which an Arguer presents Content to an Addressee.Jan argued the evidence was admissable by waving the warrant in the air.
attributes.content: The Arguer wants the Addressee to entertain the Content, which can be a proposition to be believed or a course of action to be taken, based on the Support presented.Jan argued that the evidence was inadmissable.
attributes.medium: This FE identifies the physical or abstract setting in which the Content is conveyed.Jan argued in writing that the evidence was inadmissable.
attributes.time: The Time at which an Arguer makes an argument for the Content.
attributes.degree: This FE identifies the Degree to which an arguing event occurs.Jan argued the defendant's innocence beyond a shadow of a doubt.
attributes.arguer: The Arguer presents the Content before the Addressee.Jan argued that the evidence was inadmissable.
attributes.addressee: Addressee is the entity before whom the Arguer presents a Content. Jan argued to the court that the evidence was inadmissable.
attributes.duration: The period of time for which the Arguer presents his or her reasoning to the Addressee.
attributes.group: An entity related to the Content.

Preventing_or_letting(Event).description: An Agent avoids an Undesirable_situation under certain Circumstances. That situation may be an activity (e.g. going to school), or an entity (perhaps) metonymic for such an activity or situation (e.g. the curb).  In this frame, the situation is undesirable from the Agent's point of view (e.g. evade), and contrasts with scenes in which the situation is specifically undesirable to someone else (e.g. forbear) or from the point of view of an external morality (e.g. abstain).

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.time: The Time is when the Potential_hindrance or Agent keeps the Event from taking place.
attributes.means: The action performed by an Agent that brings about the prevention or allowing.
attributes.undesirable_situation: This FE identifies the situation that the Agent avoids.
attributes.purpose: The situation that the Agent hopes to bring about with their action.
attributes.degree: This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.
attributes.explanation: This FE denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows.
attributes.circumstances: A situation that accompanies the preventing or allowing.
attributes.agent: The Agent is the sentient being which keeps the Event from happening.
attributes.place: The Place is where the Potential_hindrance or Agent keeps the Event from taking place.
attributes.manner: Any description of details of the event that influence the overall understanding and impression, such as the attitude of an Agent (casually) or the overall nature of the event (the same way).
attributes.depictive: A description of the Agent or an entity of the Event while they are involved in the action.
attributes.event: The Event is prevented from occurring by the Preventing_cause or the Agent.
attributes.allowed_category: A category that the Event fits into, which dictates the Event's being permitted or prevented (in accord with some implicit Principle.)
attributes.frequency: How often the event occurs.
attributes.period_of_iterations: The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.
attributes.event_description: In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. There are two somewhat distinct subgroups of sentence modifiers that cover this function.
attributes.potential_hindrance: The Potential_hindrance is the force which keeps the Event from happening, or does not.

Motion(Event).description: This frame binds together the various parts of movement, from setting out, to traveling, to arriving.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.speed: The Speed is the rate at which motion occurs.
attributes.path: Path refers to (a part of the) ground the Mass_theme travels over or to a landmark the Mass_theme travels by.
attributes.goal: Goal is the location the Mass_theme ends up in.
attributes.theme: The Theme is the entity that changes location. Note that it is not necessarily a self-mover.
attributes.time: When the event occurs.
attributes.area: The place where the overall motion event takes place, thus including Source, Path, and Goal locations.
attributes.distance: This FE is any expression which characterizes the extent of motion.  This frame element occurs throughout the motion domain but is very infrequent in Motion.Noise.
attributes.source: The Source is the location the Theme occupies initially before its change of location.
attributes.cotheme: The Cotheme is the second moving object, expressed as a direct object or an oblique.
attributes.duration: The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing.
attributes.mode_of_transportation: The Mode_of_transportation expresses how the motion of the Mass_theme is effected, by its body or by a vehicle which holds and conveys the Mass_theme. Vehicles can move in any way and in any medium. They are usually expressed obliquely with 'in' or 'by'.
attributes.result: This FE identifies the result of the Fluid moving.
attributes.initial_state: A previous state that the Theme was in before the beginning of its motion.
attributes.means: An action of the Agent which brings about the motion of the Fluid.
attributes.degree: Degree of abundance.
attributes.handle: The Agent's manipulation of the Theme may be further specified as being localized to some part of the Theme, a Handle. The Handle is usually expressed as a PP
attributes.depictive: This FE identifies the Depictive phrase describing the Fluid throughout the action.
attributes.cause: An event or force that causes the Fluid to move.
attributes.place: The spatial setting in which the Mass_motion takes place.
attributes.instrument: The entity manipulated by the Agent which causes the Fluid to move.
attributes.agent: The animate protagonist who causes the Fluid to move.
attributes.subregion: Subregion identifies the part of the Theme that makes contact with the resulting location. When Subregion is expressed, there usually is no Goal expressed.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation is the reason for the fluidic motion.
attributes.manner: Any description of the motion event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Mass_theme that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully)
attributes.fixed_location: The point or set of points that define the limits of motion for the Theme.  For spinning motions, it is the axis, for vibrating it is a boundary, for swinging it is a point.
attributes.locus: The Agent's manipulation of an Theme may be further specified as being localized to some part of the Theme, a Locus.  This FE is usually expressed as a PP Complement.
attributes.periodicity: The number of times the Theme returns to a state in a given duration.
attributes.angle: Angle identifies the amount that the Theme turns.
attributes.bodypart_of_agent: This FE identifies the part of the Agent's body being used to manipulate the Theme.
attributes.direction: This FE is used for expressions that indicate motion along a line from the deitic center towards a reference point (which may be implicit) that is neither the Goal of the posture change nor a landmark along the way of the moving part of the body.  Often Direction is defined with reference to the canonical orientation of the Mass_theme, or the orientation imposed by an implicit observer.
attributes.purpose: In cases wherein the Mass_theme is construed as a sentient entities, this FE denotes the state of affairs that the entities wish to bring about by mass movement.
attributes.carrier: The Carrier is the means of conveyance of the Theme.
attributes.iterations: The frame element Iterations is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.
attributes.containing_event: An event that the described motion forms an integral part of.
attributes.path_shape: The shape of the overall Path travelled by the Theme.
attributes.frequency: This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often.
attributes.fluid: The Fluid is the entity that changes location and moves in a fluidic way.
attributes.configuration: The Configuration encodes information about the amount, arrangement, and unitization of the flow. The water cascaded in torrents .
attributes.mass_theme: The mass of entities which moves.

Temporary_leave(Event).description: A Person takes leave from his or her routine Activity (such as work or school) for a Duration of time.  The Duration can be any length of time, as long as the absence is temporary.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.type: The kind of leave being taken by the Person.
attributes.frequency: How often the absences occur.
attributes.duration: The amount of time the Person is absent from his or her Activity.  This can also be expressed as a description of a duration, as shown below:
attributes.depictive: A characterization of the absence.
attributes.location: The place in which the Person spends his or her leave.
attributes.purpose: The Person's intended purpose for the temporary leave.
attributes.person: The person who is absent from his or her Activity for a Duration of time.
attributes.time: The time at which the leave occurs.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation for the Person's absence.
attributes.activity: This FE describes the activity or responsiblilities from which the Person is taking a temporary leave.

Damaging(Event).description: An Agent affects a Patient in such a way that the Patient (or some Subregion of the Patient) ends up in a non-canonical state.  Often this non-canonical state is undesirable, and some lexical units (marked with the Negative semantic type) specifically indicate that the Patient is negatively affected.  Some lexical units of this frame indicate by what means the Patient is altered (e.g., scrape.v) and in some cases give some indication of the detailed effect on the Patient (e.g., score.v, chip.v), and in other cases, both are specified (tear.v). For another set of lexical units, the action and its result are much less specified (e.g., damage.v).

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.patient: The entity which is affected by the Agent so that it is damaged.
attributes.instrument: An entity directed by the Agent that interacts with a Patient to accomplish the damage.
attributes.result: Result of the Agent's action.
attributes.subregion: The part of the Patient which is directly affected by the damaging.
attributes.explanation: A state of affairs that the Agent is responding to in performing the action.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the location of the scene where a Agent damages a Patient.
attributes.manner: Any description of the action of damaging which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.means: An intentional action performed by the Agent that accomplishes the damage.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the time when the Agent damages the Patient.
attributes.degree: The degree to which the Patient is damaged.
attributes.cause: An event which leads to the damage of the Patient.
attributes.agent: The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the damage to the Patient.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the purpose for which an Agent causes the damage to the Patient.
attributes.character_of_end_state: A description of the state of the Patient after the damaging has taken place, including descriptions of the severity and the permanence of the damaged condition.

Destroying(Event).description: A Destroyer (a conscious entity) or Cause (an event, or an entity involved in such an event) affects the Patient negatively so that the Patient no longer exists.  An asteroid obliterated the dinosaurs.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.purpose: An event that the Agent hopes to bring about by breaking an Artifact.
attributes.place: The place at which the event takes place.
attributes.role: The category in which the Patient is destroyed.
attributes.destroyer: The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the Patient's destruction.  Who can unmake the ring?
attributes.medium: Medium expresses the Medium in which the Patient is destroyed by the Cause or Destroyer.  This FE is generally used in Metaphorical uses of this frame. West demolished Kraft's arguments in his most recent essay.
attributes.means: The action that the Agent performs which results in the Artifact being inoperable.
attributes.instrument: An entity directed by the Agent that interacts with a Whole_patient to accomplish its fracture.
attributes.explanation: A state of affairs that the Agent is responding to in performing the action.
attributes.depictive: This FE is used for any Depictive phrase describing the state of particpant while lack of functionality is being rendered.
attributes.containing_event: This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.
attributes.cause: An inanimate entity or force that renders the Artifact non-functional.
attributes.frequency: Meaning: This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often. It is to be distinguished from Iteration, which pertains simply to the number of times an event occurs--Iteration expressions answer the question how many times.
attributes.subregion: The part of the Whole_patient which is directly affected by the breakage.
attributes.result: This FE identifies the Result of an event.
attributes.time: The time at which the event takes place.
attributes.manner: A holistic description of the event (e.g. the same way), including depictions of the Agent in terms of how the state of the Agent affects the overall action (e.g maliciously).
attributes.patient: The entity which is destroyed by the Destroyer.  Who can unmake the ring?
attributes.degree: Degree to which event occurs
attributes.whole_patient: The entity which is destroyed by the Agent and that ends up broken into Pieces.
attributes.resistant_surface: The Resistant_surface is the surface against which a Agent presses the Whole_patient.
attributes.pieces: The fragments of the Whole_patient that result from the Agent's action.
attributes.agent: The sentient entity causes the Artifact to not function.
attributes.artifact: The device that no longer works.
attributes.duration: The length of time that the Artifact is (or has been) rendered nonfunctional.

Death(Event).description: The words in this frame describe the death of a Protagonist.  A Cause of death may also be expressed obliquely.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.protagonist: The FE Protagonist is the being or entity that dies.  With verbs in this frame, the Protagonist is the External Argument.
attributes.result: The FE Result indicates what occurs as the result of the death of the Protagonist.
attributes.depictive: The FE Depictive denotes the state of the Protagonist as the death occurred.  I think he died happy.
attributes.explanation: This FE describes how the Deceased passed away.
attributes.maleficiary: An individual negatively affected by the death of the Protagonist.
attributes.manner: Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).
attributes.containing_event: This FE identifies the larger event in which the Protagonist dies, i.e. changes from living to dead.
attributes.time: The Time when the Deceased passed away.
attributes.degree: Some measure of the event, generally frequency.
attributes.place: The Place where the Deceased passed away.
attributes.frequency: How often the loss occurs.
attributes.duration: How long the event takes place.
attributes.sufferer: The being or entity that emotionally experiences the death of the Deceased.
attributes.timespan: The period over which a loss has occurred.

Perception_active(Event).description: This frame contains perception words whose perceivers intentionally direct their attention to some entity or phenomenon in order to have a perceptual experience.  For this reason we call the perceiver role in this frame Perceiver_agentive.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.manner: Manner expressions may be of lexicographic interest if they describe properties of active perception as such: closely, carefully, etc.
attributes.phenomenon: Phenomenon indicates the entity or phenomenon to which the Perceiver_agentive directs his or her attention in order to have a perceptual experience. Typically, it is expressed as an Object with verbs.
attributes.ground: Ground is the perceptual background against which the Phenomenon is experienced by the Perceiver_agentive.
attributes.means: The Means indicates the tool or method the Perceiver_agentive is using to actively perceive the Phenomenon.  May be confused with Direction in cases with through-PP, but is referring more to the instrument used than the path used.
attributes.duration: This FE identifies the Duration of  time for which the Perception takes place.
attributes.depictive: State is used for predicate expressions that apply to the Phenomenon, providing some information about the state it is in while the perceiver's attention is directed to it: The detective watched the suspect fleeing.
attributes.obscuring_medium: The Obscuring_medium is the medium through which the Phenomenon makes itself perceivable to the Perceiver_agentive.  This is similar to the Direction, but occurs in the opposite direction and implies a movement of the Phenomenon.
attributes.direction: Direction is used for all path-like expressions that describe how the perceiver's attention is directed during the act of perception, with the exception of those indicating the location of the Perceiver_agentive (which would be marked Location_of_perceiver)
attributes.expected_entity: An entity or state-of-affairs that the Perceiver_agentive hopes, fears, or expects to find within the Phenomenon.
attributes.location_of_protagonist: This FE is the position of the Perceiver during the act of perception.  Typically, it is expressed in a from-PP.
attributes.time: When the activity of attempting to perceive occurs.
attributes.perceiver_agentive: The Perceiver_agentive performs some action in order to have a perceptual experience. It is expressed as an External Argument:
attributes.state: State is the location, activity, or other characteristic of the Phenomenon.
attributes.purpose: Some action that the Perceiver_agentive is trying to accomplish by directing their own attention.
attributes.place: The general location within which the act of perception takes place.
attributes.body_part: Body_part identifies the part of the body used as a sensory organ of the Perceiver_agentive, typically expressed in a with-PP.

Presence(Event).description: An Entity is understood to be experienceable within a particular set of delimited Circumstances, which may be more narrowly expressed by a Time, Place.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.time: A time at which the entity is in existence.
attributes.place: Where the Entity exists.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances marks expressions that indicate a set of conditions under which the Entity is declared to exist
attributes.entity: Some entity, abstract or concrete, which is stated to exist.
attributes.descriptor: A characterization of the presence or absence of the Entity.
attributes.degree: The degree to which the Entity is present.
attributes.location: The Location of the Entity. The Location is conceived as a ground for an event of inspection to determine the presense of the Entity.
attributes.duration: The period during which the Entity exists.
attributes.depictive: This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action.
attributes.purpose: The purpose of the Entity.
attributes.concessive: This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.
attributes.state: The condition that the Entity exists in.
attributes.viewpoint: The perspective of an individual who judges whether they consider the Entity (or further state of affairs) to exist or not.
attributes.explanation: A situation, force, or entity which brings about the existence of the Entity.
attributes.inherent_purpose: The reason why the Entity exists.  Generally, this is more specifically the reason why the Entity was made.

Influence(Event).description: An Agent, Situation or Entity has an influence on a Cognizer. The influence may be general; or it may be manifested in the Cognizer's engaging in an Action as a consequence of the influence; or the Cognizer may be influenced in how they carry out a Behavior that they are engaged in already. Alternatively, a Product may be specified whose production or design was influenced by the Cognizer's experience of the  Situation or Entity.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.place: The location where the Cognizer accepts the Content.
attributes.event_description: This FE applies to appraisals of the Subjective_influence event.
attributes.action: An Action that the Cognizer decides to carry out as a consequence of the influence of a Situation or Entity.
attributes.descriptor: This is typically an adjective describing a nominal target.
attributes.time: The time at which the Cognizer is affected by an outside Event.
attributes.domain: The field in which one maintains influence.
attributes.agent: The Agent acts to influence a Cognizer.
attributes.behavior: A Behavior that the Cognizer is engaged in independently but whose execution is subsequently influenced by the Situation or Entity.
attributes.cognizer: The person who perceives the Event and changes his or her mind.
attributes.product: An entity that stands metonymically for the actions and considerations that produced it.
attributes.situation: A state of affairs--- which can be an event, state or conditions---that has an influence on the Cognizer.
attributes.entity: A person or thing that has an influence on the Cognizer.
attributes.content: The new idea that the Cognizer accepts as a result of experiencing the Event.
attributes.manner: Any description which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly) and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).
attributes.degree: The degree to which the Cognizer's mind is changed.
attributes.event: The Event which motivates the Cognizer to change his/her mind.

Receiving(Event).description: The state-of-affairs immediately after the Recipient has come into possession of the Theme offered by the Donor.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.recipient: The person who acts to come into possession of the Theme.
attributes.time: The time at which the Recipient comes into possession of the Theme.
attributes.donor: The person who gives the Theme to the Recipient.
attributes.manner: The character of the Recipient which saliently affects the action, or a general description of the action itself.
attributes.theme: The entity that changes possession, beginning in the possession of the Donor and ending up with the Recipient.
attributes.mode_of_transfer: The system whereby the Theme travels (literally or metaphorically) so that the Recipient comes into possession of the Theme.
attributes.countertransfer: A good given or a service rendered by the Recipient, in return for wich the Theme is given to the Recipient by the Donor.
attributes.role: A role that the Theme is intended to fill by the Donor.
attributes.purpose_of_donor: The aim of the Donor, which they believe will be accomplished by giving  the Theme.
attributes.means: The act that the Recipient performs which brings about their reception of the Theme.
attributes.purpose_of_theme: What the Recipient intends to do with the Theme.
attributes.depictive: The state of the Recipient or Theme during the action.
attributes.place: The location at which the Recipient comes into possession of the Theme.
attributes.path: When the Theme is received physically by the Recipient from the Donor, the Path of motion of the Theme  may be specified.

Check(Event).description: An Inspector attains a degree of certainty in the Unconfirmed_content, generally by inspecting some evidence.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.place: This FE describes where the verificiation event takes place.
attributes.medium: The Medium is the piece of text or work in which the Inspector verifies the Unconfirmed_content:
attributes.means: An action performed by the Inspector by which the Inspector manages to establish the truth of the Unconfirmed_content.
attributes.condition: The conditions under which the the verification will occur.
attributes.purpose: The state of affairs that the Inspector hopes to bring about by going through the verification.
attributes.descriptor: This FE describes a characteristic of the verification event.
attributes.explanation: The reason for the state of the verification event.
attributes.time: This FE describes the Time at which the verification event takes place.
attributes.inspector: The individual or individuals that ascertain that the Unconfirmed_content is true.
attributes.manner: Any description of the verification which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Inspector that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.communicative_force: This FE indicates the Communicative_force or authority with which the target operates (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.).
attributes.degree: The amount of certainty which the Inspector achieves after the process of verification.
attributes.unconfirmed_content: An open proposition that the Inspector decides by examining evidence.  It is usually a propostion put forward which some parties would disbelieve or contest.
attributes.instrument: A tool or instrument used by the Inspector in the verification process.

Hostile_encounter(Event).description: This frame consists of words that describe a hostile encounter between opposing forces (Side_1 and Side_2, collectively conceptualizable as Sides) over a disputed Issue and/or in order to reach a specific  Purpose.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation for which an event occurs.
attributes.degree: The Degree to which an event occurs.
attributes.instrument: The Instrument with which an intentional act is performed.
attributes.side_1: One of two participants in a hostile encounter.
attributes.place: The location at which the hostile encounter takes place.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
attributes.purpose: The desired result of the outcome of the hostile encounter for the Side_1 or for all the Sides collectively.  It may either directly refer to the state of affairs that is desired, e.g.
attributes.depictive: A Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action.
attributes.side_2: One of two participants in a hostile encounter, usually the second mentioned.
attributes.sides: The jointly expressed sides in a hostile encounter.
attributes.manner: Any expression which describes a property of the hostile encounter. Descriptions of the intensity count as Manner expressions. After Brundle's Jaguar took off like a scalded cat, it was Mass who hunted it down, an soon engaged it in a lurid battle.
attributes.means: Means describes the way in which a side engages in a hostile encounter. President Corazon Aquino of the Philippines is bracing herself for a legal battle over her decision to allow the remains of the former president, Ferdinand Marcos, to be returned home from Hawaii for burial.
attributes.issue: An unresolved question over which the two sides of a hostile encounter are in disagreement.
attributes.time: The Time at which the hostile encounter occurs.
attributes.internal_cause: The body movement may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an Internal Cause, the Agent's mental or emotional state.  Internal Cause is expressed in a PP complement.
attributes.result: The Result of an event.
attributes.duration: The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing.

Killing(Event).description: A Killer or Cause causes the death of the Victim.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.time: The point or period of time within which the Victim is killed.
attributes.depictive: The state of the Killer or Victim during the killing.
attributes.degree: The Degree appears with adjectives to describe the killing potential of an object or with nouns to describe how widespread the killing is.
attributes.means: The method or action that the Killer or Cause performs resulting in the death of the Victim.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.
attributes.killer: The person or sentient entity that causes the death of the Victim.
attributes.cause: An inanimate entity or process that causes the death of the Victim.
attributes.beneficiary: This extra-thematic FE applies to participants that derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate.
attributes.frequency: This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often.
attributes.purpose: The state of affairs that the Killer is trying to bring about by killing.
attributes.victim: The living entity that dies as a result of the killing.
attributes.manner: Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of a Killer that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.place: The location where the death took place.
attributes.result: The state of the Victim that results from being killed.  (Normally this is somewhat redundant.)
attributes.instrument: The device used by the Killer to bring about the death of the Victim.
attributes.period_of_iterations: The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.
attributes.explanation: The preexisting state of affairs that the Killer is responding to.
attributes.containing_event: This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.

Conquering(Event).description: This frame describes a Theme losing its autonomy and perhaps sustaining material damage as the result of a successful invasion on the behalf of a Conqueror.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.theme: The Theme is the land, government, and its people that is seized by the Conqueror.
attributes.means: The action by which the conquering event is made possible through the efforts of the Conqueror.
attributes.instrument: The tool used by the Conqueror to seize the Theme.
attributes.manner: The manner in which the Conqueror takes over the Theme.
attributes.depictive: This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action.
attributes.degree: This FE describes the intensity and extent of the conquering event.
attributes.frequency: Frequency is the number of times the Conquering event occurs per some unit of time.
attributes.time: The Time at which the Conqueror seizes the Theme.
attributes.purpose: The reason why the Conqueror seized the Theme.
attributes.place: The location where the Conqueror takes over the Theme.
attributes.conqueror: The Conqueror is the entity that overtakes the Theme.

Releasing(Event).description: The Authorities release a Suspect who has been held under suspicion of having committed a crime.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.means: The action of the Agent which brings about the release.
attributes.time: The Time identifies when the Agent release the Theme .
attributes.holding_location: The place that the Suspect is no longer confined to.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation identifies the reason for which the Agent releases the Theme.
attributes.suspect: The Suspect is the person released by the Authorities, having been held under suspicion of having committed a crime.
attributes.authorities: The Authorities are those who have the official authority to release a Suspect.
attributes.place: The location where the Theme ceases to be confined.
attributes.manner: Any description of the release which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.purpose: The Purpose identifies the purpose for which the Agent release the Theme.
attributes.judge: The Judge, as head of  the Court, determines the Accused's bail.
attributes.accused: At the time of bail setting, the Accused is held without bail/bond, released on his/her own recognizance, or required to give the Court  a specific amount of money for bail.
attributes.status: Status idenitifies the decision made with regard to bail.  The possible statuses are "without bail/bond", "on one's own recognizance", or a specific amount of money required for bail.
attributes.location_of_confinement: The location to which the Theme's motion was formerly inhibited.
attributes.concessive: This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.
attributes.captor: The Captor is the individual who ends the confinement or captivity of the Theme. The release of the Theme is in accord with the plans of the Captor.
attributes.circumstances: The state of the world when the Releasing event occurs.
attributes.theme: The Theme is the person or object in motion released by the Agent.
attributes.agent: The Agent is the individual who ends the confinement or captivity of the Theme.

Attack(Event).description: An Assailant physically attacks a Victim (which is usually but not always sentient), causing or intending to cause the Victim physical damage. The attack is a response to an earlier attack by the Victim on the current Assailant (or by actors associated with the Assailant or Victim).

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.path: The Path refers to (a part of) the ground over which the Assailant travels.
attributes.re-encoding: This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the Re-encoding, but not necessarily.
attributes.means: An intentional action performed by the Assailant that accomplishes the assault.
attributes.assailant: The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the Victim.
attributes.result: The Result of the attack on the Victim by the Assailant.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.
attributes.depictive: This FE is used for any Depictive phrase describeing the state of the Assailant or Victim while the Attack occurs.
attributes.manner: Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Assailant that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.iterations: The frame element Iterations is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the place where the Assailant makes an assault on the Victim.
attributes.weapon: An entity used by the Assailant to cause damage to the Victim.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the time when the Assailant attacks the Victim.
attributes.containing_event: This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.
attributes.victim: This Victim is the being or entity that is injured by the Assailant's suicide attack.
attributes.event_description: In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole and describes and describes the event more generally.
attributes.source: The starting-point of the motion of the Assailant or projectiles of the Assailant as they move toward the the Place that the Victim is occupying in the attack.  In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion.  With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the purpose for which an Assailant attacks the Victim.
attributes.duration: For how long the Land is invaded by the Invader.
attributes.frequency: How often the Invader invades the Land.
attributes.direction: This FE is used for expressions that indicate motion along a line from the deitic center towards a reference point (which may be implicit) that is neither the goal of motion nor a landmark along the way.
attributes.period_of_iterations: The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.
attributes.degree: This FE describes how intense the invation of the Land is.
attributes.type: This FE indicates the subtype of invasion into the Land.
attributes.land: The political area that is being crippled by the Invader's entry.
attributes.invader: The army or other self-directed entity that is entering the Land in a hostile manner.

Earnings_and_losses(Event).description: An Earner receives Earnings by providing Goods to a Buyer; providing the Goods also generally entails a cost, which may or may not be included in the consideration.  This frame emphasizes the effect on the Earner and often generalizes across an indefinite number of transactions with various parties.  Some of the LUs (e.g. earn.v) primarily refer to the to the Earnings without reference to cost, others to the amount the Earnings differ from the cost, emphasizing either a net loss (e.g. loss.n) or net gain (e.g. net.n).

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.rate: In some cases, earning is described per unit of Goods.
attributes.unit: This FE is any unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a by -PP
attributes.purpose: A state of affairs that the Earner intends to bring about as a result of participating in the Commercial Transaction.
attributes.buyer: The Buyer is the source of the Earnings of the Earner.
attributes.means: The means by which the Earner gains money.
attributes.earnings: Earnings are the money given to the Earner in a transaction, generally in exchange for Goods.
attributes.manner: Any description of the action of earning which reveals correllated details, especially characterizations of the Earner which influence the event.
attributes.place: The location where the Earner makes their Earnings.
attributes.goods: Goods is anything including labor or time, for example, which is exchanged for Earnings in a transaction.
attributes.containing_event: This FE identifies an event during which the Earner receives Earnings in a transaction.
attributes.time: The time when the Earner makes their Earnings.
attributes.explanation: This FE denotes a proposition from which the event of earning or losing logically follows.
attributes.earner: The Earner is involved in a transaction or set of transactions as the party that receives payment.

Choosing(Event).description: An Agent has an Attribute which can take different Values, and the Agent selects and then begins to use some Value for that Attribute.  The Attribute includes both physical (shape, color) and abstract (belief, practice) types.  For some LUs in this frame, it is common for only the Value to be expressed, with the Attribute implicit. (Often this implicit attribute can be given second-layer expression on the Value. Note that such second-layer annotation should be assumed in the first two examples below.)

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.duration: Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.
attributes.communicative_force: This FE indicates the Communicative_force or authority with which the target operates (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.). This may or may not reflect the actual reality of the state of affairs.
attributes.depictive: Depictive labels an independent descriptor of a Cognizer in a  choosing event.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the Place where the choosing occurs.  The winner was selected in the secret meeting room.
attributes.event_description: In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
attributes.instrument: The instument through which an Agent adopts a Value for an Attribute.
attributes.agent: The Agent selects a Value for his/her Attribute and begins to use it.
attributes.value: The Value, chosen and made effective by the Agent, specifies the Attribute.
attributes.manner: Any description of the selecting event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of a Cognizer that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.explanation: This FE  identifies the Explanation for which the Cognizer chooses the Chosen.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by which bthe Cognizer accomplishes the choosing.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the Time when the Cognizer chooses the Chosen.
attributes.frequency: This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.
attributes.role: This FE identifies the role filled by a particular participant of the clause headed by the target. In so doing, it relates the state of affairs evoked by the target to another background state of affairs by indicating that one of the role fillers of the current frame also fills a second kind of role in the background, either generically or in some specific instance.
attributes.containing_event: This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.
attributes.re-encoding: This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the Purpose for which an Agent adopts the Value of the Attribute.
attributes.attribute: The Attribute of the Agent can take on several Values, selected by the Agent .  The Council of Constance (1414-18) adopted conciliarism as a stance, hoping that it would permit the election of a pope acceptable to both Catholic factions.
attributes.chosen: Chosen identifies the entity or course of action which is selected from among the Possibilities.
attributes.topic: Topic occurs quite rarely in this frame and usually only as a PP Complement of a noun target:
attributes.possibilities: A Cognizer makes a choice from among a set of Possibilities. Possibilities are commonly expressed via an oblique phrase which indicates the alternative or alternatives, or by a subordinate clause (choosing to do it or choosing not to do it), typically headed by "whether or "if".
attributes.inherent_purpose: The Cognizer intends the Chosen to fulfill an Inherent_purpose . Samsonchose  Delilahas a wife.
attributes.contrast: The hypothetical Chosen that is less desirable for the Cognizer.
attributes.cognizer: The Cognizer chooses the Chosen out of the Possibilities.
attributes.larger_purpose: This FE identifies the Larger_purpose for which the Cognizer chooses. It exemplifies what the Cognizer hopes to accomplish by choosing the particular Chosen.

Traveling(Event).description: An Agent matches location with an Entity in order to fulfill some  Purpose.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.entity: The physical entity that is permanently associated with entities or characteristics that the Agent wishes to use for some Purpose.  During the visit, the Agent matches location with the Entity.
attributes.means: The action done by the Traveler by which the traveling is accomplished.
attributes.time: When the traveling occurs.
attributes.iterations: The number of times the trip is traveled by the Travelers.
attributes.frequency: The Frequency with which the Traveler makes the journey.
attributes.dependent_state: A state (of the Agent) that results as a consequence of the Agent being situated at the Entity.
attributes.normal_location: The location that the Agent normally resides in or is (permanently) associated with.
attributes.agent: The sentient entity that is temporarily with the Entity in order to fulfil some Purpose.
attributes.place: The Place is the location of the motion. It describes the area in which motion (with a specified Source, Path or Goal) takes place.
attributes.manner: The Manner in which the traveling takes place.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the Purpose for which the Traveler travels, i.e. the future state of affairs that will hopefully come about.
attributes.depictive: The state of the Traveler during the journey.
attributes.duration: This FE identifies the Duration of  time during which the trip occurs.
attributes.co-participant: The Co-participant is the person or persons who accompany the Traveler on the journey.
attributes.ground: The perceptual background against which the Attraction is experienced by the Tourist.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
attributes.attraction: The societally-recognized unique location that the Tourist experiences.
attributes.tourist: The individual that is seeking an experience at an Attraction.
attributes.result: The affect of travel on a Traveler.
attributes.travel_means: This FE applies to expressions that indicate documents, money, tickets, etc. which allow people to engage in travel.
attributes.goal: The Goal is the location where the travelers end up.
attributes.speed: The Speed is the rate at which the travel takes place.
attributes.direction: The direction in which the Traveler goes.
attributes.period_of_iterations: The Time throughout which the traveling repeatedly takes place.
attributes.distance: This FE dientifies the Distance traveled.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation for which the travel is undertaken.
attributes.path: The Path is the route along which the travel takes place.
attributes.source: The Source is the starting point of the trip.
attributes.mode_of_transportation: The Mode_of_transportation expresses how the motion of the Traveler is effected, by their body or by a vehicle which holds and conveys the Traveler. Vehicles can move in any way and in any medium. They are usually expressed obliquely with 'in' or 'by'.
attributes.area: This is the Area in which the traveling takes place. This frame element describes the enclosed area inside which travelling, of unspecified Source, Path or Goal takes place.
attributes.descriptor: A characterisitic of the traveling event.
attributes.traveler: This is the living being which travels. Normally, the Traveler is expressed as an external argument.
attributes.baggage: The Baggage are the items necessary for travel that accompany the Traveler.

Recovering(Event).description: The action of an Agent or the occurrence of a Cause event returns an Entity to an earlier  state of vigor and strength.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.agent: The Agent puts the Entity into a state of renewed vigor.
attributes.frequency: This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often.
attributes.event_description: This FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole, either appraisals of the event, or descriptions of the rejuvenation event as role fillers in other frames.
attributes.entity: The concrete or abstract thing that is brought into an earlier state in which it was more effective and powerful.
attributes.manner: Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.role: Role is used for the capacity in which the Entity is Rejuvinated, and is expressed in as-PPs.
attributes.cause: An event or state whose occurrence brings about the Entity's return to a vigorous state.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the place where the Agent brings about the change in the Entity's state.
attributes.result: The end state of the Rejuvination action.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the time when the Agent causes the renewal of the Entity.
attributes.instrument: The device used by the Agent to help accomplish the action indicated by the target.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the purpose for which an Agent brings about the revitalization of the Entity.
attributes.iterations: The number of times that an Entity is caused to return to a more effective state.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the action that the Agent performs in order so as to bring about the reinvigoration of the Entity.
attributes.domain: The Domain within which the Entity is affected.
attributes.degree: This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.

Using(Event).description: An Agent manipulates an Instrument in order to achieve a Purpose.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.
attributes.period_of_iterations: This FE modifies a clause with an iterative interpretation, which may be signified by the simple present tense on the main verb.
attributes.degree: This frame element selects some gradable attribute of the Instrument or the Using act and modifies the expected value for it.
attributes.agent: The Agent uses the Instrument to achieve their Purpose.
attributes.manner: Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action ( deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.duration: Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by which an Agent uses the Instrument.
attributes.frequency: This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question "how often."
attributes.depictive: This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. The depicted state does not necessarily or usually facilitate or cause the state of affairs reported by the target.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the place where the Agent uses the Instrument.
attributes.containing_event: An event within which the Agent uses the Instrument. Often, the Containing_event will also give an indication of the Agent's Purpose.
attributes.instrument: An entity directed by the Agent that serves to bring about the Purpose of the Agent.
attributes.role: An Instrument that has a function associated with it.
attributes.group: This FE identifies the population within which the Using event occurs.
attributes.outcome: The Outcome is the failure or success of the Agent's using the Instrument to achieve their Purpose.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the purpose for which an Agent uses the Instrument.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the time when the Agent uses the Instrument.

Coming_to_be(Event).description: An Entity comes into existence at a particular Place and Time which may take a certain Duration_of_endstate, have a Cause, or be formed from Components.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.components: This FE identifies the components out of which the Entity forms.
attributes.entity: Concrete or abstract entity that did not exist before the Time of the event.
attributes.role: The form in which the Entity comes to be.
attributes.explanation: This FE labels the Explanation of the formation of the Entity.
attributes.place: This is the Place where the new Entity comes into being.
attributes.time: This FE identifes the Time when a new Entity comes into existence.
attributes.duration_of_final_state: This FE identifies the length of time that the Entity exists after coming to be.
attributes.period_of_iterations: This FE identifies the Period_of_iterations during which habitual or iterative actions are performed.
attributes.manner: The way in which the Entity comes to be.
