Cause_to_be_included(Event).description: An Agent or Cause makes a New_member part of  Group. The Group may be represented by an individual Existing_member if it implies the existence of a set of members.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.time: This FE identifies when the inclusion of the New_member to the Group occurs.
attributes.new_member: An item that becomes a part of the Group.
attributes.existing_member: Something that is already a member of the Group and represents the Group as a whole.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies what the Agent hopes to accomplish by including a New_member to a Group.
attributes.agent: The Agent is a volitional animate being who causes the New_member to become part of the Group.
attributes.manner: The manner in which the Agent acts.
attributes.cause: An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that is responsible for causing a New_member to enter a Group.
attributes.group: The Group is anything that can be conceptualized as a complex collection of parts or ingredients, including through metonymy like containers or locations, which New_members can join.  The companyincludes philanthropic endeavors in their accomplishments
attributes.means: An intentional action performed by the Agent that accomplishes the inclusion of a New_member.
attributes.place: The location in which a New_member is entered into a pre-existing Group.

Process_start(Event).description: An Event begins at a certain Time and Place. Reason may also be indicated.  NB:  Refer to Event frame.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.manner: This FE identifies the Manner in which an Agent starts an Activity.
attributes.duration: The period of time for which the Process is ongoing after it has started.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the Place where the Agent starts an Activity.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. I
attributes.frequency: The number of times that the specified type of Event begins.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the Time when the Agent starts an Activity.
attributes.initial_subevent: The Initial_subevent of the Event.The service began with a prayer.
attributes.event: Name of the Event which occurs.
attributes.result: Result of the Event.
attributes.depictive: This FE identifies the Depictive phrase describing the actor or undergoer of an action.
attributes.containing_event: This FE identifies an event during which the Agent starts the Activity.
attributes.communicative_force: This FE indicates the Communicative_force or authority with which the target operates (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.).
attributes.agent: This FE identifies the being that starts the intentional Activity.
attributes.co-timed_event: This FE identifies the first Co-timed_event of the started Activity.The peace march  started with a prayer.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the Purpose for which an Agent engages in a starting Activity.
attributes.event_description: In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. There are two somewhat distinct subgroups of sentence modifiers that cover this function.
attributes.activity: This FE identifies the Activity that an Agent starts.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.
attributes.new_situation: A consecutive event to the starting of the Activity of the Agent.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by which an Agent starts an Activity.
attributes.concessive: This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.

Change_event_time(Event).description: An Agent decides temporarily not to perform a Desirable_action or not to interact with a Salient_entity.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.time: The time at which the change in duration of the Event is caused.
attributes.agent: The sentient entity that changes the duration of the Event.
attributes.desirable_action: Desirable_action identifies the event or activity in which the Agent does not engage for a while.
attributes.circumstances: This FE identifies the Circumstances under which the Agent does not engage in the Desirable_action.
attributes.end_point: The point in time, defined either as a clock time or in terms of an event that takes place, at which the Agent engages in the Desirable_action or interacts with the Salient_entity.
attributes.degree: The extent to which the initial and final durations differ from each other.
attributes.salient_entity: An entity that evokes a contextually inferrable Desirable_action that the Agent is temporarily forgoing.
attributes.purpose: An action that the Agent intends to accomplish by  changing the duration of the Event.
attributes.place: The location at which the expected time of the Event changes.
attributes.means: An intentional action performed by the Agent (or event resulting from the Cause) that produces a change in the Event's duration.
attributes.explanation: A state of affairs that the Agent is responding to in bringing about the change of duration.
attributes.manner: Any description of the  event causing the change of the Event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Agent that also affect the action (deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.duration: Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of the Agent's decision to forgo a Desirable_action to the point in time when the Agent engages in the action.
attributes.destination_event: The Destination_event is the occasion which the timing of the Event occurs with respect to.
attributes.landmark_time: The Landmark_time is when the Event was originally intended to take place.
attributes.interval: The Interval between the Landmark_time and the Destination_time may be expressed.
attributes.cause: An event that causes the change in Event duration.
attributes.destination_time: The Destination_time is the time at which the Event actually occurs.
attributes.new_duration: The new duration of the Event.
attributes.initial_duration: The planned duration of the Event before the change takes place.

Reporting(Event).description: In this frame an Informer informs the Authorities of the illegal or otherwise improper Behavior of the Wrongdoer.  Tony reported Michael to the police for breaking into his car.   The teacher reported the bathroom vandalism. DNI

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.authorities: The Authorities are the officials, government or otherwise, who handle misbehavior.
attributes.wrongdoer: The Wrongdoer has his or her activities reported to the Authorities.
attributes.behavior: The Behavior is the action or actions for which the Wrongdoer is reported.
attributes.informer: The Informer reports the activities of the Wrongdoer to the Authorities.
attributes.place: The Place is the location where the reporting occurs.
attributes.time: The Time when the Informer reports the Behavior of the Wrongdoer.
attributes.purpose: The Purpose is the purpose for which the Informer reports the Wrongdoer.

Bodily_harm(Event).description: The words in this frame describe situations in which an Agent or a Cause injures a Victim. The Body_part of the Victim which is most directly affected may also be mentioned in the place of the Victim.  In such cases, the Victim is often indicated as a genitive modifier of the Body_part, in which case the Victim FE is indicated on a second FE layer.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.instrument: This FE is any object used to cause the injury.
attributes.purpose: Purpose identifies the purpose for which a harm-causing action is carried out.
attributes.concessive: This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the Cause_harm event) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.
attributes.manner: Manner in which the injury takes place.
attributes.body_part: The location on the body of the Experiencer where the bodily injury takes place.
attributes.subregion_bodypart: The Subregion_bodypart defines the precise location on the Body_part which is harmed.
attributes.agent: Agent is the person causing the Victim's injury.
attributes.time: The time when the harming event occurs.
attributes.particular_iteration: This FE indicates that the Cause_harm event is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
attributes.duration: The period of time during which the Experiencer repeatedly receives bodily injuries.
attributes.place: The place where the harming event occurs.
attributes.containing_event: The event in which the bodily injury takes place.
attributes.result: Result identifies the result of the Agent's action.
attributes.victim: The Victim is the being or entity that is injured.  If the Victim is included in the phrase indicating Body_part, the Victim FE is tagged on a second FE layer (see 3rd example).
attributes.re-encoding: A description of the harm event which significantly displays a different aspect.
attributes.period_of_iterations: The length of time from when the Cause_harm event began to be repeated to when it stopped.
attributes.means: An intentional action performed by the Agent that accomplishes the action indicated by the target.
attributes.explanation: A fact or action somehow related to the Victim that the Agent responds to by causing harm to the Victim.
attributes.degree: Degree is the degree to which the Agent causes harm to the Victim.
attributes.cause: The Cause marks expressions that indicate some non-intentional, typically non-human, force that inflicts harm on the Victim
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the Cause_harm event and any of its participants.
attributes.iterations: The number of times that the injury happens to the Experiencer.
attributes.depictive: Depictive identifies any Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action.
attributes.frequency: The number of times that the Experiencer has an experience of bodily harm.
attributes.injuring_entity: The Experiencer injures him/herself on an Injuring_entity.
attributes.severity: The extent to which the Experiencer is affected by the injury.
attributes.experiencer: The being or entity that is injured.

Suspicion(Event).description: A person or group, the Authority, believes that another person, the Suspect is a participant in a criminal Incident.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.incident: The (typically criminal) Incident in which the Suspect is suspected of being involved.
attributes.suspect: The Suspect is the target of the Authority's suspicion.
attributes.time: When the suspecting takes place.
attributes.authority: The Authority is the group or person who suspects the Suspect of criminal activity.

Statement(Event).description: This frame contains verbs and nouns that communicate the act of a Speaker to address a Message to some Addressee using language. Instead of (or in addition to) a Speaker, a Medium may also be mentioned. Likewise, a Topic may be stated instead of a Message. A number of the words can be used performatively, such as declare and insist.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.degree: This FE selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.
attributes.event_description: This FE describes the Message event.
attributes.medium: Medium is the physical entity or channel used by the Speaker to transmit the statement.
attributes.topic: The Topic is the subject matter to which the Message pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by "about", but in some cases it can appear as a direct object.
attributes.containing_event: This FE identifies an event during which the Speaker produces the Message.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE indicate that the particular Message event referred to is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. Most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.
attributes.place: The FE specifies the location where the Message takes place.
attributes.speaker: The Speaker is the sentient entity that produces the Message (whether spoken or written).  It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the target
attributes.addressee: The Addressee is the person to whom the Message is communicated. When this FE is expressed, it often appears in a prepositional phrase introduced by "to", or as a direct object.
attributes.message: The Message is the FE that identifies the content of what the Speaker is communicating to the Addressee.  It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
attributes.depictive: The state of the Speaker during the Message.
attributes.means: An act whereby the Speaker makes a Message.
attributes.occasion: The Occasion is the reason a public Message is given.
attributes.internal_cause: The emotional or physical state of the Speaker that leads to their speaking.
attributes.manner: The Manner of performing an action.
attributes.frequency: This FE is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.
attributes.group: The Group of Speakers or Mediums within which the Message is made.   Much would be achieved if these were more widely acknowledged.
attributes.communicative_force: This FE indicates the Communicative_force or authority with which the Message is expressed (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.).
attributes.time: The Time at which the Message is made.
attributes.iterations: The FE Iterations is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.

Claim_ownership(Event).description: A Claimant asserts his or her right to possession of a piece of Property (either real, such as land, or private).  The Claimant may be acting on the behalf of a Beneficiary.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.claimant: The Claimant asserts rights or priviliges, typically ownership, over some Property.
attributes.property: The Property is declared to be under the ownership of the Claimant.
attributes.beneficiary: The Beneficiary is declared the owner of the Property by the Claimant, or the person or group in whose name or favor the Claimant is acting.
attributes.role: The Role of the land claimed.

Cause_change_of_position_on_a_scale(Even.description: This frame consists of words that indicate that an Agent or a Cause affects the position of an Item on some scale (the Attribute) to change it from an initial value (Value_1) to an end value (Value_2). The direction of the change (Path) can be encoded as well as the magnitude of the change (Difference).

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.co-variable: The Co-Variable is the scale that the (dependent ) Variable is measured against.
attributes.path: Any expression that says something about the movement of the entity (Item) along the scale between its initial (Value-1) and its final position (Value-2).
attributes.place: The location where the Agent changes the value of an Attribute.
attributes.means: An act performed by the Agent that brings about the change in the position of the Item on the scale.
attributes.value_1: The initial value of the entity (Item) along the scale.
attributes.speed: The rate at which the entity's positon on the scale changes.
attributes.item: The entity whose position along a scale is being changed.
attributes.attribute: The scale along which the Item ranges in value.
attributes.agent: The person who causes an entity (Item) to change its positon on a scale with respect to some property (Variable).
attributes.difference: The distance between the orginial value (Value-1) and the final value (Value-2) of the entity on the scale (Variable).
attributes.cause: The force that causes the change.
attributes.purpose: The purpose for which an intentional act is performed.
attributes.time: When the event occurs.
attributes.manner: Any description of the Agent changing the value of an Attribute which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.value_2: The final position on the scale that the entity (Item) assumes.

Coming_to_believe(Event).description: A person (the Cognizer) comes to believe something (the Content), sometimes after a process of reasoning. This change in belief is usually initiated by a person or piece of Evidence. Occasionally words in this domain are accompanied by phrases expressing Topic, i.e. that which the mental Content is about.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.means: An act performed by the Cognizer which enables them to figure something out.
attributes.content: With a target verb, the Content is usually expressed as a finite clausal Complement or an Object NP, and may sometimes be expressed by a PP:
attributes.manner: Manner of performing an action
attributes.depictive: Depictive phrase describing the Cognizer.
attributes.medium: Medium is the text created by the Cognizer to communicate that they came to believe a specified Content.
attributes.place: The location at which the Cognizer realizes the Content.
attributes.cognizer: Cognizer is the person who comes to believe something.
attributes.time: The time at which the Cognizer discovers the Content.
attributes.degree: The Degree to which the Cognizer comes to believe the Content.
attributes.evidence: Words in this frame may occur with a PP headed by from which expresses the Evidence on which knowledge or belief is based:
attributes.topic: Some verbs in this frame may occur with postverbal Topic expressions: They found out about us! More generally verbs in this frame may occur with quantificational nouns followed by Topic expressions:

Expressing_publicly(Event).description: A Speaker addresses an Audience on a particular Topic.  The Audience is generally passive, although for many types of address (including academic talks and press conferences), a discussion or question-answer period is virtually always required.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the particular public expression logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the expression, but not in all cases.
attributes.medium: Medium is the observable action or product of the Communicator.
attributes.manner: Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Communicator that also affect the action (eagerly).
attributes.audience: The person or persons to whom the Speaker delivers their text.
attributes.speaker: The person who orally delivers a text about a Topic to a passive Audience.
attributes.place: The FE specifies the place where the communication takes place.
attributes.topic: What the text that the Speaker produces is about.
attributes.time: The time when the Content is communicated.
attributes.occasion: The Occasion is the reason a public statement is given.
attributes.purpose: The Purpose is the desired result of public expression.
attributes.addressee: The Addressee is the person to whom the Content is communicated.
attributes.depictive: The state of the Communicator during the statement.
attributes.means: An act whereby the Communicator communicates the Content.
attributes.internal_cause: The emotional or physical state of the Communicator that leads to their communication.
attributes.content: The attitude or feeling that the Communicator had not previously expressed.
attributes.frequency: This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE indicate that the particular Statement event referred to  is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. Most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.
attributes.circumstances: The state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the communication and any of its participants.  Quite often, Circumstances secondarily provide an Explanation for the particular communication.
attributes.communicator: The Communicator is the person who expresses the Content (whether spoken or written).

Request(Event).description: In this frame a Speaker asks an Addressee for something, or to carry out some action.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.depictive: This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. The depicted state does not necessarily or usually facilitate or cause the state of affairs reported by the target.
attributes.manner: Manner indicates the manner in which the Message is delivered.
attributes.iterations: The frame element Iterations is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.
attributes.speaker: The Speaker, as in other communication frames, is generally an External Argument.
attributes.time: The interval during which the Speaker makes the request.
attributes.medium: The Medium is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the Message. The Medium is frequently expressed as a PP Complement headed by on or in.
attributes.message: The Message is the content of the request that can be expressed as a quote, in a finite or non-finite clausal Complement, an NP Object or PP Complement.
attributes.means: An act performed by the Speaker that results in a request being made and received.
attributes.topic: The Topic is rarely expressed in this frame but can occur as a PP Complement headed by about.
attributes.containing_event: This FE denotes an event that occurs, or a state of affairs that holds, at a time that includes some time that the request was occuring. This often makes us of "as" and "while".
attributes.beneficiary: This extra-thematic FE applies to participants that are expected to derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate.
attributes.addressee: In this frame the Addressee can either occur as an NP Object (usually with a following complement clause) or as a PP Complement of verbs or nouns.

Control(Event).description: A Controlling_entity has control of a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.degree: The Degree to which the Controlling element affects the Dependent element.
attributes.controlling_entity: A thing or person whose behavior controls a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable.
attributes.place: The location at which the controlling occurs.
attributes.dependent_variable: A scalar variable, whose value depends on the behavior of a Controlling_entity, a Controlling_situation, or a Controlling_variable.
attributes.concessive: This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.
attributes.dependent_entity: An entity, usually a thing, that is influenced in its behavior by a Controlling_entity or an Controlling_situation.
attributes.dependent_situation: A situation whose temporal or other characteristics are influenced by a Controlling_entity, Controlling_situation, or Controlling_variable.
attributes.manner: Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Influencing_entity that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.time: The Time at which the controlling occurs.
attributes.duration: The length of time over which the domination takes place.
attributes.competitor: The Competitors are trying to gain control of a situation, but end up being subject to the control and influence of the Agent .
attributes.agent: The Agent has a controlling position in the Situation.
attributes.situation: The Situation is primarily affected by the Agent, in particular how it develops or concludes.
attributes.controlling_variable: A scalar variable (with unspecified value) which has an effect on the Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable.
attributes.controlling_situation: A situation whose temporal or other characteristics control a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable.

Self_control(Event).description: An Agent actively (yet not always with success) attempts to keep themselves from participating in an Event. The Agent is usually pushed to the Event because of an internal urge.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.place: The Place  is where the Agent attempts to prevent the Event from taking place.
attributes.agent: The Agent who tries to keep an Event from taking place.
attributes.degree: This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.
attributes.time: The Time is when the Agent prevents the Event from taking place.
attributes.event: The Event is the action or state of affairs that the Agent wishes to prevent.

Supporting(Event).description: A Supporter assists to strengthen the Supported by lending itself in material aid (or abstract assistance in the case of metaphorical uses).

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.explanation: A state-of-affairs from which the accomplishment would be predicted.
attributes.purpose: The situation that the Supporter wishes to bring about by supporting the Supported.
attributes.manner: This FE identifies the Manner in which a Supporter supports the Supported.
attributes.duration: The time period during which the Supporter supports the Supported.
attributes.supported: The Supported is given strength through the assistance of the Supporter.
attributes.means: An action that the Supporter undertakes in service of the Supported's strengthening.
attributes.supporter: The Supporter acts to benefit the Supported by providing additional strength or stability.
attributes.degree: The measure to which the Supporter's assistance brings the Supported added strength and support.
attributes.time: This FE identifies when the support occurs.
attributes.instrument: An entity used by the Supporter in service of the Supported's strength by support.
attributes.event_description: A clause describing the event as a whole.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the Place where the support occurs.

Defending(Event).description: A Defender successfully repels the aggressive attempt of takeover by an Enemy.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.degree: This FE describes the intensity and extent of the repelling event.
attributes.enemy: The  Enemy is the entity that fails to overtake the Defender.
attributes.result: This FE describes the outcome of the repelling event.
attributes.instrument: An entity used by the Defender fend off the Assailant .
attributes.defender: This FE is the being or entity that responds forcefully to the Assailant's attack.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the purpose for which an Defender defends the Victim from the Assailant.
attributes.invasion_act: This FE refers to the Invasion_act perpetrated by the Enemy.
attributes.manner: Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Defender that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.place: This FE identifies the place where the Defender defends the Victim from the Assailant.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the time when the Defender takes forceful action against the Assailant.
attributes.means: An intentional action performed by the Defender that accomplishes their defense of the Victim.
attributes.victim: The individual or entity that is under attack from the Assailant .
attributes.assailant: The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the Victim.
attributes.location_of_protagonist: The starting-point of the motion of the Defender or projectiles of the Defender as they move toward the the Place that the Assailant is occupying.  In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion.
attributes.depictive: The state of the Defender or Victim during the Assailant's attack.
attributes.explanation: A state of affairs that the Defender is responding to that leads them to protect the Victim.
attributes.location_of_assailant: The location of the Assailant or the weapons of the Assailant.

Building(Event).description: This frame describes assembly or construction actions, where an Agent joins Components together to form a Created_entity, which is profiled, and hence the object of the verb.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.manner: This FE idenitifies the Manner in which an Agent builds a Created_entity.
attributes.period_of_iterations: The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.
attributes.duration: Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.
attributes.instrument: This FE identifies the Instrument(s) with which an Agent builds a Created_entity.
attributes.result: This FE identifies the Result of the act of building. We glued the airplanes together.
attributes.beneficiary: This extrathematic FE applies to participants that derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate. Further, the target predicate should involve some sort of Agent that intends that the benefit go to the Beneficiary.
attributes.agent: The Agent builds a Created_entity.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the Time when the building occurs.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by which an Agent builds a Created_entity.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.
attributes.components: This FE identifies the Components that form the Created_entity.
attributes.depictive: Depictive identifes the phrase describing the participant in the act of building.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the Place where the building occurs.
attributes.created_entity: Created_entity identifies the entity that is created in the act of building.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the Purpose for which an intentional act is performed.

Military_operation(Event).description: The Military of a Possessor (either a nation, institution, or private individual) conducts large-scale activities in a Area to accomplish military or combined military/non-military goals.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.force: The Force carries out the operation. Depending on the size of the operation, this may be as few as one individual or as large as the armed forces of a nation.
attributes.duration: The length of time over which the operation is carried out.
attributes.area: The Area in which the Military is conducting operations.
attributes.possessor: The Possessor controls the army and ultimately directs its goals and methods.
attributes.manner: A description of the operation or participants that are not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Military that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.means: The means by which the Military carries out its operation.
attributes.time: The Time at which the operations are carried out.
attributes.opponent: The nation, group, or situation which the operation opposes.
attributes.place: The location of the operation.
attributes.domain: The Domain of the operation, e.g., military, intelligence.
attributes.goal: The Goal of the operation.

Self_motion(Event).description: The Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a Path. Alternatively or in addition to Path, an Area, Direction, Source, or Goal for the movement may be mentioned.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.depictive: Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action
attributes.manner: Any expression which describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory or rate of motion expresses the frame element Manner. Descriptions of steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as Manner expressions.
attributes.path: Path is used for any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal.  This includes "middle of path'' expressions.
attributes.place: The Place is the location within which a defined motion takes place.  Any specified or implied  Source, Path or Goal should designate a location contained with the Place.  This FE can be differentiated from Area by the fact that the annotated phrase can be used in the same meaning with non-motion targets.
attributes.result: Result of an event
attributes.internal_cause: The emotional or mental state of the Self_mover which motivates them toward motion or the particular manner of motion.
attributes.explanation: The state of affairs that leads to the particular motion that the Self_mover adopts.
attributes.speed: The rate at which the location of the Self_mover changes with respect to time.
attributes.means: An act whereby the Self_mover achieves movement.
attributes.area: Area is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path.  Note that this FE should not be used for cases when the same phrase could be used with the same meaning with a non-motion target, since these should be annotated with the Place FE.
attributes.path_shape: The shape of the overall Path travelled by the Self_mover.
attributes.direction: The direction that the Self_mover heads in during the motion.
attributes.goal: Goal is used for any expression which tells where the Self_mover ends up as a result of the motion.
attributes.concessive: An event or circumstance that would not be expected given the nature of the particular Self_motion event.
attributes.duration: The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing.
attributes.source: Source is used for any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion.
attributes.distance: Any expression which characterizes the extent of motion expresses the frame element Distance.
attributes.external_cause: External_cause is something in the external environment that causes the Self_mover  to move.
attributes.cotheme: An entity whose motion is correlated with that of the Self_mover, following and tracking the Self_mover, being followed and tracked, or with both parties mutually matching Paths.  We clomped down to the shore with a whole troop of younglings. I had little hope of catching up, but I crawled after her as fast as I could. The troops marching in front of him paid no attention to the beggar by the roadside.
attributes.self_mover: Self_mover is the living being which moves under its own power. Normally it is expressed as an external argument.
attributes.coordinated_event: The label Coordinated_event is to be used for phrases denoting an event-it does not allow states-that the Traversing is rhythmically aligned with. The Coordinated_event is conceived of as independent: it would occur regardless of the event expressed by the target, which is not even an incidental or optional sub-part of the Coordinated_event.
attributes.time: The time when the motion occurs.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the purpose for which a Self_mover moves.

GetReady(Event).description: The Protagonist is in an initial state, before beginning to be involved in the Activity, but all pre-conditions for performance of the Activity have been satisfied.  In many cases, the Protagonist is an intentional agent, but there are other uses in which the agent is deprofiled, and the Protagonist is an entity which is essential to the Activity.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.duration: The length of time that the Protagonist remains capable of the Activity without beginning it.
attributes.protagonist: This FE identifies the Protagonist in the initial state of an activity.
attributes.degree: This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.
attributes.activity: The action that the Protagonist is prepared to do.
attributes.time: The time when the Protagonist is ready.
attributes.salient_entity: An entity which stands in metonymically for the Activity.
attributes.result: The state or event that follows due to the ready state.

Forming_relationships(Event).description: Partner_1 interacts with Partner_2 (also collectively expressible as Partners) to change their social relationship.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.partner_2: The individual whose relationship with Partner_1 changes.
attributes.partner_1: The individual who comes to form a relationship with Partner_2.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.
attributes.communicative_force: This FE indicates the Communicative_force or authority with which the Forming_relationship event operates (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.).
attributes.frequency: How often the Forming_relationship event occurs.
attributes.depictive: A salient state of Partner_1, Partner_2, or Partners which affects the perception of the formation of relationship.
attributes.duration_of_final_state: The length of time that the changed relationship status lasts.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows.
attributes.partners: The individuals whose relationship is changing.
attributes.means: The action that Partner_1 or the Partners take in order to bring about the change in the relationship.
attributes.iterations: The frame element Iterations is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.
attributes.purpose: The state-of-affairs that the Partners or Partner_1 hope to bring about by changing their status.
attributes.place: Where the relationship is formed.
attributes.manner: Any description of the event including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Partner_1 or Partners that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.time: The time when the relationship changes.

Becoming_a_member(Event).description: A New_member becomes a member of a socially-constructed Group.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.explanation: A factor that explains why the New_member joins the Group.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by which the New_member becomes part of the group.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the purpose for which the New_member joins the Group.
attributes.group: The Group is a socially-constructed entity composed of members.
attributes.re-encoding: This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action.
attributes.depictive: The state of the New_member when they join.
attributes.frequency: The Frequency with which the New_member becomes a member of a Group.
attributes.role: The capacity or role in which the New_member is placed upon joining the Group.
attributes.manner: Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of a New_member that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.place: This FE identifies the place where the joining occurs.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.
attributes.reciprocation: This FE denotes an event paired with that of the main clause, which explains why the event of the main clause is expected. In particular, reciprocation is used to indicate an action that is being rewarded or punished in the main clause, or an action that is paired with the action in the main clause as the other side of an agreement.
attributes.new_member: The New_member becomes a member of a (socially-defined) Group.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the time when the New_member joins the Group.

Execute_plan(Event).description: An Agent acts to ensure that a Rule (often a constraint on behavior) is being followed. The Agent's action is according to a general plan for Rules (such that implicit in the Rule is the affordance to certain entities to ensure that the Rule is followed). The Rule may be specified for the Duration for which it is in effect.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.medium: This FE describes the medium through which a plan was executed.  It may occur in the same syntactic position as the Agent.
attributes.means: The Means is an intermediate action done by the Agent in order to execute the Plan.
attributes.manner: The Manner describes some state of the Agent, or provides additional characterization of the event of executing the plan.
attributes.outcome: The Outcome is the failure or success of executing the plan.
attributes.place: The Place at which the Plan is or is not operational.
attributes.circumstances: The state-of-affairs under which the Agent puts the Plan into effect.
attributes.explanation: A cause, reason, or other explanation for the implementation of the Plan
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the Purpose for which the Agent executes the Plan.
attributes.time: The Time at which the Agent puts the Plan into effect.
attributes.focal_participant: The individual or group who is obligated to follow the Plan.
attributes.duration: The length of time for which the Plan is or is not in effect.
attributes.agent: The Agent, often an institution or governmental organization, puts a Plan into effect. The Agent is generally a primary participant in the Plan, but a separate Focal_participant may be specified.
attributes.rule: The Rule is the set of constrants on behavior that the Agent implements (i.e., forces others to obey or face consequences).
attributes.degree: This FE describes how fully the Plan was executed.
attributes.plan: The Plan is a goal or purpose that the Agent carries out.

Action(Event).description: This is an abstract frame for acts performed by sentient beings. It exists mostly for FE inheritance.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.agent: This FE marks expressions that denote the person whose conduct is being evaluated.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
attributes.period_of_iterations: The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.
attributes.act: This FE identifies the Act that the Agent performs intentionally.
attributes.event_description: This FE gives a description of the Intentionally_act event.
attributes.domain: The Domain of human behavior in which the Agent acts in a certain Manner
attributes.frequency: The Frequency with which the Agent does the Act in a given period of time.
attributes.manner: This FE marks expressions that characterize the way that the Agent behaves.
attributes.explanation: This FE marks expressions that indicate why an Agent behaved in a certain way.
attributes.means: The way in which the Agent behaves in the specified manner.
attributes.result: The Result of an act.
attributes.apparent_conclusion: This FE describes an additional situation or modification that would seem to hold given the rest of the situation. In some cases, it marks a completely separate conclusion than one would draw from the manner of the event in the main clause.  As far as we know, this idea is only explicitly marked in English with "as if".
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the purpose for which an Agent performs an intentional act.
attributes.time: The Time when the Agent behaves in a certain way.
attributes.place: The location at which the Agent exhibits their behavior.
attributes.affected_party: A person to whom behavior is directed by the Agent.
attributes.degree: The extent to which the (usually 'good' or 'bad') conduct of the Agent deviates from some standard or norm
attributes.standard: An explicit point to which the conduct of the Agent is compared.
attributes.circumstances: This FE marks expressions that indicate a set of Circumstances under which the Agent acts in a particular way.

Removing(Event).description: An Agent causes a Theme to move away from a location, the Source.  The Sourceis profiled by the words in this frame, just as the Goal is profiled in the Placing frame.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.depictive: Depicitive phrase describing either the Agent or Theme of the emptying. Naked, Millhouse emptied the trash can.
attributes.time: The time at which the emptying takes place.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.
attributes.direction: This FE is used to indicate the Direction that the Theme travels when it is removed.
attributes.means: The Means by which the Agent empties the Source.
attributes.agent: The Agent is the entity that does the emptying.
attributes.path: The Path is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal.
attributes.means_of_motion: The Means_of_motion expresses the conveyance with which the Agent effects the motion of the Theme. The Means_of_motion holds and conveys the Theme. Means_of_motions can move in any way and in any medium. They are usually expressed obliquely with 'in' or 'by'.  Weevacuated the population by helicopter.
attributes.goal: The Goal is any expression which tells where the Theme ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion.
attributes.instrument: This is the object with which the Agent empties the Source.
attributes.place: The location where the emptying takes place.
attributes.distance: The Distance is any expression which characterizes the extent of motion.  This frame element occurs throughout the motion domain but is very infrequent in Motion_Noise.
attributes.degree: The Degree to which the Agent empties the Source.
attributes.result: The Result of  the Agent emptying the Source.
attributes.cause: The Cause is the non-sentient force which instigates the emptying. A basic washing can degrease your workclothes.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.
attributes.source: The Source is the region or container which is emptied of something.  In this frame, the Source occurs as an NP Object. Pat cleared the table.
attributes.purpose: To what end the Agent or Cause removes the Theme.
attributes.theme: The Theme, when overtly expressed, invariably occurs in a PP Complement headed by "of".
attributes.co-timed_event: An event the punctuates the larger Removing event.
attributes.manner: The Manner in which the Agent empties the Source.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
attributes.cotheme: The Cotheme is the second moving object, expressed as a direct object or an oblique.
attributes.containing_event: This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.

Surrendering(Event).description: In this frame a Fugitive presents himself or herself to the Authorities to be subject to the criminal process.  The bank robber surrendered to Berkeley police.   Norte is expected to surrender to police tomorrow on tax fraud charges .

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.fugitive: The Fugitive is wanted by the Authorities and turns himself or herself in to the Authorities.
attributes.time: The Time is when the Fugitive surrenders.
attributes.place: The Place is the location where the surrendering occurs.
attributes.explanation: This FE denotes a proposition from which the surrendering event logically follows.
attributes.manner: This FE identifies the Manner in which the Fugitive surrenders to the Authorities.
attributes.charges: The Charges is the offense for which the Fugitive is wanted.
attributes.authorities: The Authorities are the officials, government or otherwise, who are in charge of initiating the criminal process.

Surrendering_possession(Event).description: A Surrenderer is compelled to transfer a Theme to a Recipient.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.manner: The Manner is the manner in which the Surrenderer gives the Theme to the Recipient.
attributes.frequency: This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often. It is to be distinguished from Iteration, which pertains simply to the number of times an event occurs-Iteration expressions answer the question how many times.
attributes.communicative_force: This FE indicates the Communicative_force or authority with which the target operates (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.).
attributes.re-encoding: This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame.
attributes.time: The Time is when the Surrenderer gives the Theme to the Recipient.
attributes.degree: This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.
attributes.surrenderer: The person compelled to transfer the Theme to the Recipient.
attributes.means: The Means by which the Surrenderer gives the Theme to the Recipient.
attributes.purpose: The Purpose for which the Surrenderer gives the Theme to the Recipient.
attributes.explanation: This FE denotes a proposition from which the surrendering event logically follows.
attributes.place: The Place where the Surrenderer gives the Theme to the Recipient.
attributes.period_of_iterations: This FE modifies a clause with an iterative interpretation, which may be signified by the simple present tense on the main verb.
attributes.recipient: The entity that ends up in possession of the Theme.
attributes.containing_event: This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.
attributes.theme: The object that changes possession.
attributes.result: This FE identifies the Result of an surrendering event.
attributes.event_description: In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. There are two somewhat distinct subgroups of sentence modifiers that cover this function.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the Surrendering event itself and any of its participants.
attributes.depictive: This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action.

Agree_or_refuse_to_act(Event).description: A Speaker either agrees to or refuses to engage in a Proposed_action, proposed by an Interlocutor.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of response events.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by which the Speaker responds to the request or offer made.
attributes.frequency: The number of times (within a given period) that the agreeing/refusing to act occurs.
attributes.manner: Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including  secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of the Speaker that affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly).
attributes.internal_cause: The response may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an Internal_cause, the Speaker mental or emotional state.
attributes.depictive: Depictive phrase describing the Speaker.
attributes.medium: As with Medium in other communication frames, the physical entity or channel used to communicate can be expressed.
attributes.interlocutor: This is the person who proposed the Proposed_action  to the Speaker and to whom the Speaker communicates  their response.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.
attributes.co-timed_event: This FE identifies the subevent of the agreeing/refusing to act.
attributes.purpose: An action that the Speaker intends to accomplish by agreeing or refusing to perform the Proposed_action that is requested of, or suggested to  them.
attributes.time: The time interval during which the Speaker makes their verbal response concerning the proposed action.
attributes.speaker: The Speaker is the person to whom a particular action has been proposed and who responds to the request or offer made.
attributes.event_description: This FE applies to appraisals of the event, typically a judgment of its expectedness, and consists of any descriptions of the state of affairs denoted by the target as role fillers in other frames. The state of affairs reported by the target is understood to play a role in the state of affairs of the modifier.
attributes.place: The location in which the Speaker  gives their verbal response to the proposed action.
attributes.role: Role denotes the status that the Interlocutor requested to be granted.
attributes.proposed_action: The Proposed_action is an action that the Speaker would perform if they were to accept or refuse the request or offer.

Participation(Event).description: An Event with multiple Participants takes place. It can be presented either symmetrically with Participants or asymmetrically, giving Participant_1 greater prominence over Participant_2. If the Event is engaged in intentionally, then there is typically a shared Purpose between the Participants. It is, however, possible that an expressed Purpose only applies to Participant_1.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.time: The Time when the multiple-participant Event occurs.
attributes.participants: The individuals or entities that have been participants in an Event.
attributes.participant_2: A grammatically less prominent participant of an Event with multiple Participants.
attributes.means: An intentional action performed by Participant_1 or the Participants that contributes to bringing off the Event.
attributes.participant_1: Participant_1 is the grammatically more prominent participant in an Event with multiple Participants.
attributes.event: An Event with multiple Participants, who may or may not be involved intentionally.
attributes.degree_of_involvement: The extent to which Participant_1 contributes to the Event's coming off.
attributes.manner: Any description of the Event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). When the Participants are understood agentively frames, it may indicate salient characteristics of them that also affect the action (deliberately, eagerly).
attributes.purpose: An action that the Participants or Participant_1 intend to accomplish by performing the action indicated by the Event.
attributes.institution: A group, location, or institution conventionally associated with an Event.
attributes.place: The location where the Event involving multiple Participants occurs.
attributes.duration: This FE describes the length of time for which participation occurs (usually appears as a for-PP)

Deciding(Event).description: A Cognizer makes a Decision, which may be about an entity or a course of action.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.manner: Any description of the selecting event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including general descriptions comparing events (the same way) and salient characteristics of the Cognizer that also affect the action.
attributes.cognizer: The Cognizer is the person who repeatedly changes their mind about which of the Options to choose.
attributes.circumstance: The conditions under which the Cognizer makes a Decision.
attributes.possibilities: A Cognizer makes a Decision from among a set of Possibilities.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the Place where the Cognizer keeps changing their mind between the Options that present themselves.   Do they know better than us that our dithering at the UN gave Saddam time to hide, destroy, and shuffle his weapons programs?
attributes.decision: Decision identifies the entity or course of action upon which the Cognizer decides.
attributes.time: This FE denotes the Time interval during which the Cognizer keeps changing their mind about which of the Options to select.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which it logically follows that the Cognizer keeps changing their mind about the Issue.
attributes.inherent_purpose: The Cognizer intends the Decision to fulfill an Inherent_purpose . Samson ruled out  Delilah as a wife.
attributes.duration: In the cases where the Cognizer does not act on their choice, the Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of the Cognizer's deliberations to the end. In situations where the Cognizer does act on the Options, the Duration denotes the length of the interval during which the Cognizer repeatly changes from one option to the other.
attributes.issue: The Issue is a question about a course of action or a choice between items.
attributes.option_1: When there is an explicitly separate construal of the Options, Option_1 is the first-mentioned alternative, typically in the form of a from-PP. When it is clear that  the Cognizer actually acted on their choice, Option_1 is the alternative they embraced first before pursuing Option_2.
attributes.options: The Options are the alternative courses of action or the alternative physical or concrete entities that the Cognizer can choose from.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.
attributes.containing_event: This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.
attributes.option_2: When there is an explicitly separate construal of the Options, Option_2 is the second-mentioned alternative, typically in the form of a to-PP. When it is clear that  the Cognizer actually acted on their choice, Option_2 is the alternative they embraced after abandoning Option_1.
attributes.degree: The Degree to which the Cognizer wavers.
attributes.frequency: This FE describes the number of times within a given period that the Cognizer wavers.

Education_teaching(Event).description: This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching.  A Student comes to learn either about a Subject; a Skill; a Precept; or a Fact as a result of instruction by a Teacher.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.purpose: The state-of-affairs that the Teacher hopes to bring about by teaching.
attributes.course: FN: a program of lectures or other matter dealing with a subject
attributes.skill: An action which the Student is able to perform as a result of instruction.
attributes.time: The time when the teaching occurs.
attributes.teacher: One who instructs a Student in some area of knowledge or skill.
attributes.fact: A piece of information that the Student is informed of by the Teacher.
attributes.qualification: A formal Qualification such as an academic degree or a certificate for which a student is aiming.
attributes.depictive: Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action
attributes.means: An intentional action performed by the actor (Student or Teacher depending on the profiling of particular words) that lets them achieve the instruction or learning they are attempting.
attributes.level: This FE identifies the Level of a student in his/her education. This is  distinct from the goal or qualification towards which a student is working (Qualification ). a graduate student  a fourth grade student  The above are both Levels, in contrast to: a doctoral Student  an MA Student
attributes.material: Educational Material, such as books, tapes, or videos, used by a Teacher or a Student to acquire skills or knowledge.
attributes.student: One who is instructed by a Teacher in skills or knowledge.
attributes.degree: Degree to which event occurs
attributes.precept: A guideline for correct behavior. In most cases, this concerns morally or socially desirable actions.
attributes.role: A role, typically professional or vocational,  that the Student is meant to be able to fill as a result of their training.
attributes.manner: Manner of performing an action
attributes.duration: The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing.
attributes.subject: The area of knowledge or skill which is taught by a Teacher or to a Student.
attributes.institution: An educational establishment, such as a school or college.
attributes.place: The Place is the location within which the teaching takes place.
attributes.result: Result of an event

Emptying(Event).description: These are words relating to emptying containers and clearing areas of some substance or items. The area or container can appear as the direct object with all these verbs, and is designated  Source because it is the source of motion of the Theme. Corresponding to its nuclear argument status, it is also affected in some crucial way, unlike Source in other frames. Some words in this frame, such as empty, may also occur with Path or Goal expressions, e.g.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.means: The Means by which the Agent empties the Source.
attributes.agent: The Agent is the entity that does the emptying.
attributes.manner: The Manner in which the Agent empties the Source.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.
attributes.instrument: This is the object with which the Agent empties the Source.
attributes.place: The location where the emptying takes place.
attributes.result: The Result of  the Agent emptying the Source.
attributes.path: The Path is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal.
attributes.goal: The Goal is any expression which tells where the Theme ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion.
attributes.source: The Source is the region or container which is emptied of something.  In this frame, the Source occurs as an NP Object. Pat cleared the table.
attributes.time: The time at which the emptying takes place.
attributes.depictive: Depicitive phrase describing either the Agent or Theme of the emptying. Naked, Millhouse emptied the trash can.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.
attributes.containing_event: This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.
attributes.purpose: The reason why the Agent empties the Source of the Theme.
attributes.theme: The Theme, when overtly expressed, invariably occurs in a PP Complement headed by "of".
attributes.degree: The Degree to which the Agent empties the Source.
attributes.cause: The Cause is the non-sentient force which instigates the emptying. A basic washing can degrease your workclothes.

Getting(Event).description: A Recipient starts off without the Theme in their possession, and then comes to possess it.  Although the Source from which the Theme came is logically necessary, the Recipient and its changing relationship to the Theme is profiled.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.concessive: This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.
attributes.source: The Source is the location that the Theme formerly occupied.  Persons that begin in possession of the Theme may metonymically stand in for the Source.
attributes.time: This FE indicates the Time interval during which the Post_getting event occurs.
attributes.recipient: The individual that has just come into possession of the Theme.
attributes.manner: The way that the Recipient has the Theme
attributes.explanation: The Explanation refers to the existing eventuality that the Recipient is responding to.
attributes.purpose: The purpose for which an intentional act is performed.
attributes.result: The state that either the Recipient or the Theme end up in after the acquisition.
attributes.place: The Place denotes where the Getting takes place.
attributes.beneficiary: The Beneficiary is an entity which the Recipient passes the Theme to, or shares the Theme with.
attributes.theme: The entity which has just come into the possession of the Recipient.
attributes.circumstances: Any condition or situation that serves as a very general background, against which the further importance of the Getting is understood.
attributes.means: The Means is the action of the Recipient which results in their possession of the Theme.

Besieging(Event).description: An Assailant, a group of armed forces, surrounds the Victim, a military location and the people within it, in an attempt to cut the Victim off from the outside, with the goal of either forcing their surrender or weakening them so that an invasion would be successful. A successful siege is often followed by the Assailant taking control of (the land held by) the Victim.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the place where the Assailant makes an assault on the Victim.
attributes.victim: The Victim is the fortification or geopolitical entity that is being attacked.
attributes.means: An intentional action performed by the Assailant that accomplishes the assault.
attributes.manner: Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Assailant that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.time: This FE identifies the time when the Assailant attacks the Victim.
attributes.source: The starting-point of the motion of the Assailant or projectiles of the Assailant as they move toward the the Place that the Victim is occupying in the attack.  In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion.  With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
attributes.duration: The length of time that the Victim is under attack from the Assailant
attributes.weapon: An entity used by the Assailant to cause damage to the Victim.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the purpose for which an Assailant attacks the Victim.
attributes.assailant: The Assailant is a group of armed forces (or, metonymically, their commander or the organization they represent) that encircles, surrounds, or otherwise cuts off the Beseiged in an attempt to force surrender.
attributes.path: The Path refers to (a part of) the ground over which the Assailant travels.

Creating(Event).description: The Creator creates a new entity, the Created_entity, possibly out of Components.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.purpose: Some of the words in this frame frequently occur with a constituent expressing the Purpose for which the Idea is intended. Normally this constituent is a PP Complement headed by for or a to-marked VP Complement:
attributes.co-participant: A secondary agent with whom the Creator intentionally creates the Created_entity.
attributes.time: The Time when the Idea is created.
attributes.created_entity: This FE identifies the entity that the Agent intentionally creates.
attributes.depictive: The state of a focal participant during the time the invention takes place.
attributes.means: An act performed by the Cognizer that contributes to the creation of the Idea.
attributes.components: This FE identifies the Components that are attached together to form a Created_entity.
attributes.role: The Role that the Created_entity takes (or is intended to take, if there is a Creator).
attributes.manner: A state of the Cognizer that directly and palpably influences the overall action.
attributes.instrument: This FE identifies the instrument with which an Agent intentionally creates a Created_entitiy.
attributes.place: The location in which the Cognizer comes up with the Idea.
attributes.creator: The Creator creates a created entity.
attributes.imposed_purpose: The Creator's intended purpose for the Created_entity.
attributes.frequency: This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.
attributes.beneficiary: The Beneficiary benefits in some way from the creation of the Created_entity.
attributes.period_of_iterations: The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.
attributes.cause: An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of Causes.
attributes.recipient: The individual who is intended to receive the Created_entity.
attributes.location_of_appearance: (This FE belongs in Achieving_first, not here.)
attributes.result: Result of an event
attributes.cognizer: Cognizer is the person who comes up with or conceptualizes the Invention. It is normally expressed as an External Argument:
attributes.material: Words in this frame sometimes occur with a constituent that expresses the intellectual material from which the Idea is created. This frame element is characteristic of physical creation verbs like make; its presence gives sentences in this frame an especially strong metaphorical quality. The Material FE is normally expressed by a PP Complement headed by from or out of:
attributes.idea: Invention is the intellectual creation of the Cognizer. It is normally expressed as an NP Object, but sometimes as a PP Complement:
attributes.amount_of_progress: The extent to which the Cognizer succeeds in coming up with the idea.

Process_end(Event).description: A Process is finished and can no longer proceed.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the Place where the Agent stops the Activity.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the Time when the Agent stops the Activity.
attributes.process: A Process which is ended by the Agent or Cause.
attributes.manner: This FE identifies the Manner in which the Agent stops the Activity.
attributes.frequency: This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often. It is to be distinguished from Iteration, which pertains simply to the number of times an event occurs-Iteration expressions answer the question how many times.
attributes.degree: This FE describes the completeness of stopping.
attributes.final_subevent: The Final_subevent of an event.The peace march  ended with a prayer.
attributes.depictive: This FE is used for a Depictive phrase describing the actor or undergoer of an action.
attributes.result: This FE identifies the Result of the stopped Activity.
attributes.duration: This FE identifies the length of Time during which the Activity is stopped.
attributes.explanation: The reason the Agent stops the Activity.
attributes.agent: This FE identifies Agent that stops the Activity.
attributes.activity: This FE identifies the Activity that the Agent stops.
attributes.state: A State which is ended by the Agent or Cause.
attributes.cause: An event that causes the Process or State to end.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by which the Agent stops the Activity.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.
attributes.co-timed_event: This FE identifies the last Co-timed_event of the stopped Activity.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
attributes.re-encoding: This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame.
attributes.event_description: In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the Purpose for which an Agent stopped the Activity.
attributes.containing_event: This FE identifies an event during which the Agent stops the Activity.

Body_movement(Event).description: The words in this frame have to do with non-verbal communication. Topic is not normally expressed with these words. This seems to be related to the absence of a verbal code in cases of gestural communication. Topic can be viewed as a partial characterization of a Message, but such partial characterization is either difficult or irrelevant in the absence of a verbal code.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.place: The location within which the movement of a Body_part takes place.
attributes.indicated_entity: The Indicated_entity is the entity which the Communicator is pointing out to the Addressee as meaningful.
attributes.communicator: This is the sentient entity that communicates a Message non-verbally. It is normally expressed as an External Argument: The teacher gestured us into the room.
