attributes.old_leader: With words denoting removal (or attempted removal) from office of a leader, the Old_leader is typically the direct object of verbs, or occurs in a PP Complement with noun targets, frequently headed by the preposition against.
attributes.result: This FE  is used for indicating the Result of an event.
attributes.place: Where the change takes place.
attributes.time: When the change takes place.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by which  the Selector accomplishes the change of leadership.

Escaping(Event).description: A Dodger acts to avoid an oncoming moving Bad_entity.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.degree: This FE is used for any expression that describes  the Degree to which the Evader
attributes.explanation: A factor which explains the particular motion or manner of motion of the Self_mover.
attributes.time: The time at which the motion takes place.
attributes.manner: Any expression which describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion expresses the frame element Manner. Descriptions of steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as Manner expressions.
attributes.dodger: The Dodger acts to avoid an oncoming Bad_entity.
attributes.bad_entity: The Bad_entity is  the oncoming entity to avoid.
attributes.purpose: The state-of-affairs that the Self_mover wishes to bring about.
attributes.place: The Place is where the motion (which is specified by a Source, Path or Goal) is located.
attributes.means: An event involving the Self_mover that results in the Self_mover moving in the specified way.
attributes.self_mover: This is the entity which moves under its own power.
attributes.depictive: The state of the Self_mover during the action.
attributes.external_cause: External_cause is something in the external environment that causes the Self_mover to move.
attributes.direction: The direction in which the Self_mover goes.
attributes.path: A relation to a landmark that describes the trajectory in the midst of the motion.  (It is thus neither a Source nor the Intended_goal.)
attributes.means_of_motion: The entity used by the Self_mover in getting away from the undesirable Source.
attributes.goal: Goal identifies any expression which tells where the Escapee ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion.
attributes.internal_cause: The emotional or mental state of the Self_mover which motivates them toward motion or the particular manner of motion.
attributes.source: Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element Source. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. In particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
attributes.distance: The distance from the Source that the Self_mover ends up.
attributes.result: The state of the Self_mover at the end of the event.
attributes.duration: The amount of time for which the Self_mover moves.
attributes.cotheme: An entity whose motion is correlated with that of the Self_mover, following and tracking the Self_mover, being followed and tracked, or with both parties mutually matching Paths.
attributes.speed: The Speed is the rate at which the Self_mover moves.
attributes.undesirable_location: The Undesirable_location is where the Escapee begins.
attributes.vehicle: The device or bodypart that serves to move the Self_mover.
attributes.escapee: The Escapee manages to leave the Undesirable_location.
attributes.mode_of_transportation: This  FE identifies  the Mode_of_transportation that the Evader uses to move.  It can either bea part of the Evader's own body or a vehicle.
attributes.capture: An actual or hypothetical  event in which the Pursuer takes physical control of the Evader.
attributes.circumstances: The state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the departing event itself and any of its participants, and is merely peripherally related to the event as a whole.
attributes.evader: The Evader moves under its own power to Capture or contact with the Pursuer. Normally the Evader frame element is expressed as an external argument.
attributes.pursuer: The Pursuer is going after the Evader unless they act.
attributes.area: This FE is used for phrases that describe a general Area in which motion occurs when it is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path. Locative setting adjuncts of motion expressions may also be assigned this frame element.  Smithers fled and evaded them all over the ship.
attributes.intended_goal: Any expression which tells where the Self_mover intends to end up as a result of the motion.
attributes.re-encoding: A larger conceptualization that includes the departing as an integral part. The departure expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action in this larger conceptualization.
attributes.new_situation: An unexpected event that affects some agent (usually the Self_mover), which is enabled by, and occurs after, the departing.
attributes.coordinated_event: The label Coordinated_event is to be used for phrases denoting an event (it does not allow states) that the departing is rhythmically aligned with. (This would then further require that the departing be iterated.)  The Coordinated_event is conceived of as independent: it would occur regardless of the event expressed by the target, which is not even an incidental or optional sub-part of the Coordinated_event.
attributes.co-participant: A second moving object that moves in coordination with the Self_mover.
attributes.reciprocation: An event paired with the motion, which explains why the motion is expected. In particular, Reciprocation is used to indicate an action that is being rewarded or punished by the motion, and/or is paired with the motion as the other side of an agreement.
attributes.path_shape: The configuration formed by the entire Path of the Self_mover, taken simultaneously.
attributes.duration_of_final_state: The length of time that the Self_mover spends away from the Source.
attributes.containing_event: An event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at the time of departure and which the departure is taken to be a part of.
attributes.frequency: The number of times that an action occurs in a given time.

Aiming(Event).description: An Agent adjusts an Instrument to enable it to interact directly with a difficult-to-access Target_location.  Usually, there is a Targeted entity at the Target_location which is mentioned in its place.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.instrument: The object manipulated by the Agent in order to interact with the Targeted.
attributes.explanation: A state of affairs that provides an explanation for the Aiming event.
attributes.activity: The Activity is undertaken by the Agent and is directed towards the Targeted or Target_location.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by which the aiming is achieved.
attributes.targeted: The Targeted is the entity located in an indirectly accessible location relative to the Agent.
attributes.purpose: The reason for which the Agent attempts to interact with the Targeted
attributes.depictive: The Depictive is a phrase which describes the Agent during the event.
attributes.agent: The individual that manipulates the Instrument to enable interaction with the Targeted.
attributes.outcome: The Outcome is the failure or success of an attempt.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.
attributes.manner: Any generalized description of the details of the event in terms of comparison to another event or what would be expected of the details given some state of the Agent.
attributes.target_location: The location that the Agent wishes to ready the Instrument to access.
attributes.containing_event: A larger event during which an aiming event takes place.
attributes.location_of_protagonist: The location from which the proto-agent acts or perceives.  This does not include the location of a thing which is affected or perceived in the event.
attributes.duration: The time peiod over which the adjustment of the Instrument takes place.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the Time when the Agent takes aim.
attributes.circumstances: The state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is independent of the the aiming of the Agent, but contextualizes it.
attributes.place: The place where the Agent aims at the Targeted.

Hindering(Event).description: In this frame a Hindrance makes it more difficult for a Protagonist to complete their intended Action or a Hindrance directly affects an Action where the Action can be a natural act or the actions of many individuals in a collective endeavor.  Crucially, these lexical units do not entail that the Protagonist was unable to complete the Action or that the Action did not occur. The Hindrance may indicate a lack of enablement or an obstacle on the natural progression of the Protagonist or Action

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.means: This FE describes the means by which hindering occurs
attributes.concessive: This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause. In other words, given only the facts of the *Concessive, one would expect them to cause the world to be the opposite of what is protrayed in the main clause.
attributes.explanation: This FE label is used for the cause of the Hindrance
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.
attributes.action: The Action is what the Protagonist desires to do, which is made more difficult by the Hindrance. It can also be a natural act or collective endeavor, not linked to an overt Protagonist.
attributes.duration: The length of time over which the hindering takes place.
attributes.protagonist: The Protagonist is the entity that tends towards or plans some Action which the Hindrance causes to be more difficult.
attributes.hindrance: The Hindrance is the force which makes the Action more difficult or less likely to be successfully completed. The Hindrance may be a lack of enabling force:  The project was hampered by a lack of funds.  or the Hindrance may be an obstacle in the natural progression of the Protagonist or Action.  Burns was hindered by Smither's violent attack.
attributes.manner: The manner in which hindering occurs
attributes.time: The Time is when the Hindrance affects the Protagonist or Action.
attributes.frequency: This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.
attributes.place: The Place is the location where  he Hindrance affects the Protagonist or Action.
attributes.degree: The Degree is the extent to which the Hindrance affects the Protagonist or Action.

Preserving(Event).description: In this frame an  Agent preserves a Patient in order to prevent it from decaying.   A Medium may be used.   Bill mummified John.  Tess pickled the beets  in vinegar.  The Smiths dried the apples.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.manner: The Manner in which the Agent preserves the Patient.Jake painstakingly embalmed the next body.
attributes.depictive: The Depictive phrase describing one of the participants.The herring was cured with its innards still inside it.
attributes.medium: Medium is the substance in which the Patient might be  submerged to be preserved. Tess pickled the beets in vinegar.
attributes.result: Result of an action.
attributes.agent: The Agent is the person performing the intentional act that leads to the preservation.Arlene pickled the cucumbers.
attributes.time: The Time when the Agent preserves the Patient.Mr. Amber embalmed the woman in Turkey in 1922.
attributes.instrument: The Instrument with which an an Agent performs the Preserving.
attributes.place: The Place where the preserving occurs.Mr. Amber embalmed the woman's body in Turkey in 1922.
attributes.purpose: The Purpose for which the Agent preserves the Patient.Jude pickled the onions to increase their potency.
attributes.means: The Means by which the Agent preserves the Patient.Hannah cured the shrimp by injecting them with brine.This salami was cured naturally in salt.
attributes.degree: The extent to which the Patient is preserved from decaying.   The corpse had been mummified completely.
attributes.duration: The amount of Time for which the process of Preserving is ongoing....oak cured for eight years.
attributes.patient: The Patient is organic matter that undergoes the preservation.Tess pickled the beets in vinegar.

Create_artwork(Event).description: A Creator creates an artifact that is typically an iconic Representation of an actual or imagined entity or event. The Representation may also be evocative of an idea while not based on resemblance.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.role: This FE identifies a Role that one of the role fillers of the current frame also fills in a background context, either generically or in some specific instance.
attributes.means: An action performed by the Creator which brings about the creation of the Representation.
attributes.purpose: An action that the Creator intends to accomplish by creating the Representation.
attributes.creator: An individual or individuals that bring the Representation into existence.
attributes.reference: A representation of the entity depicted which the Creator uses as a reference in the creation of the Representation. For instance, another piece of art, a photograph, or his/her memory.
attributes.location_of_representation: The physical location that holds the Representation.
attributes.representation: The entity that is created to represent either iconically or abstractly.
attributes.time: The time at which a Representation is created.
attributes.depictive: This FE describes the Creator as being in some state during the creation of the Representation.
attributes.manner: Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of the Creator that also affect the action (deliberately, carefully).
attributes.instrument: The entity which the Creator uses to create the work of art.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the creation of the Representation ogically follows.
attributes.place: This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the Place in which the Activity is performed.
attributes.descriptor: This FE marks expressions that indicate attributes, traits, or evaluations of the Activity.
attributes.activity: This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the  Activity that is being performed habitually or conventionally.
attributes.practitioner: This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate whose Activity is at issue.
attributes.culture: A Culture within which the Activity is performed.

Openness(Event).description: A Useful_location is accessible to some (possibly generic) Theme despite a potential Barrier, or is not accessible because of the Barrier.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.useful_location: The place or thing that the Theme is headed towards, despite a potential or actual Barrier.
attributes.theme: The Theme whose motion is blocked or free.
attributes.barrier: An entity that (at least potentially) prevents the Theme from getting to the Useful_location.
attributes.degree: The extent to which a Theme can easily access the Useful_location
attributes.time: The time when the Useful_location is or is not accessible.

Connect(Event).description: A Figure is located in contact with a Ground.  With some words that evoke this frame, the Figure is also asserted to be fully or partially supported by the Ground (e.g. on), while in others a support relation is either denied (e.g. to, as in "she put her hand to the wall") or unspecified (e.g. against).  In addition, some LUs assert a direction in which to find the Figure from the Ground (e.g. atop).

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.deixis: An indication of how the locative phrase relates to the grounding of the speech situation, either locating it near (here) or far (there, yonder), or specifically separated from the speech context by distance or a barrier (over).  Fillers of this FE are restricted to this closed class of items.
attributes.figures: The Figures are items which mutually serve to identify the location of each other.
attributes.directness: An indication of how closely the position of Figure matches the prototype expected from the image schema associated with the target.  This FE is normally filled by closed-class, dedicated adverbs like right, straight, directly, and due (and some combinations of these), but also occurs with rarer items like 'smack dab'.
attributes.figure: The Figure is perceived as located relative to a certain Ground location. The figure can be an entity or an event.
attributes.accessibility: An indication of how accessible the Figure is to some participant in the speech context (either the speaker or the addressee, or some other highly salient viewpoint in a narrative).  This FE normally describes availability for manipulation and use, but may simply describe how easily seen or difficult to see the Figure is. There is a closed class of items that can fill this slot, including only 'right' indicating ease of access, and 'way', 'all the way', or (dialectally) 'clear' indicating distance and difficulty of access.
attributes.ground: The Ground serves as a basis for describing the location of the Figure.
attributes.temporal_profile: A description of how the access path to the Ground interacts with time.  This FE is filled only by the closed class adverbial back.adv (which indicates that the position was occupied by the Figure before). While this FE in its most basic use refers to cases of actual motion, it can be used with descriptions of static position, where motion is backgrounded.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the Time when the Agent intentionally affects the Item or Items. The robber tied Harry to the chair at midnight.
attributes.direction: This FE identifies the Direction from a reference location (generally, the deictic center) of a path to the Figure.  This FE is filled by one of a closed class of adverbs:  up, down, out (meaning 'beyond the boundary around the viewpoint'), back (meaning 'along a line from front to back of landmark, and relatively inaccessible'), and, more rarely, away, along, and dialectally, back down (meaning 'down and behind').
attributes.connector: The Connector forms the bond that maintains the Item or Items in a fixed position; it is usually expressed in a with-PP.
attributes.goal: Goal identifies the location to which an Item is attached.
attributes.item: This FE identifies the Item that the Agent attaches to the Goal.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the Place where the Agent intentionally affects an Item or Items. The robber tied Harry to the chair in the basement.
attributes.result: This FE identifies the Result of an attaching event.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the Purpose for which an Agent intentionally affects an Item or Items. The robber tied Harry to the chair to stop him from leaving.
attributes.duration: The time when the Attaching occurs.
attributes.period_of_iterations: The length of time from when the Attaching event began to be repeated to when it stopped.
attributes.items: This FE identifies the plural Items that are tied together, resulting in their mutual attachment.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by which an Agent intentionally affects an Item or Items. The robber tied Harry to the chair by wrapping the rope around his chest.
attributes.manner: This FE identifies the Manner in which an Agent intentionally affects an Item or Items. The robber tied Harry to the chair with enthusiasm.
attributes.handle: Thie Handle is the point of attachment on the Item to which the Agent attaches.
attributes.frequency: This frame element is defined as the number of times the Attaching event occurs per some unit of time.
attributes.agent: The Agent manipulates an object. Agent typically refers to animate beings, but is also extended to mechanical and other inanimate objects.  It is most frequently expressed as the external argument of verbs. The robber tied Harry to the chair.
attributes.instrument: This FE identifies the Instrument with which an Agent attaches an Item or Items.  Typically, it transmits the force applied by the Agent, and is not left behind as a participant in the resultant Being_attached frame.
attributes.degree: This FE identifies the Degree to which the Item ends up attached.

Reveal_secret(Event).description: A Speaker reveals Information that was previously secret to an Addressee. In some cases, the Addressee is expected to keep the Information from other parties. The Information may be damaging to the reputation of the Speaker. Instead of (or in addition to) a Speaker, a Medium may also be mentioned. Likewise, a Topic may be stated instead of Information. Some lexical units in this frame imply that the Addressee has already been confronted with the Information.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.information: Information identifies the content that the Speaker reveals to the Addressee.  It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
attributes.means: An act whereby the Speaker makes a revelation.
attributes.event_description: In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole especially any descriptions of the state of affairs denoted by the target as role fillers in other frames.
attributes.manner: Manner is any description of the revelation which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Speaker that also affect the revelation (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully, maliciously).
attributes.depictive: The state of the Speaker during the statement.
attributes.addressee: The Addressee is the person to whom the Information is revealed.
attributes.completeness: The degree to which Information is revealed.
attributes.re-encoding: An alternative description of expressed action.
attributes.descriptor: A characteristic of the revealed secret.
attributes.containing_event: This FE identifies an event during which the Speaker reveals Information.
attributes.internal_cause: The emotional or physical state of the Speaker that leads to the revelation.
attributes.time: The Time when the revelation is made.
attributes.source_material: The medium in which the secret Information origninally resided.
attributes.period_of_iterations: This FE describes the length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.
attributes.medium: Medium is the physical entity or channel used by the Speaker to transmit the statement.
attributes.speaker: The Speaker is the sentient entity that reveals  the Information (whether spoken or written).
attributes.topic: The Topic is the subject matter about which the Speaker is speaking. It normally only appears with noun targets, or in special constructions.
attributes.place: The FE specifies the Place where the Information is revealed.
attributes.location_of_protagonist: This FE is used to indicate the location of a participant in cases where the multiple participants of an event are not co-located in the typical fashion. In Release 1.2, this FE has various frame-specific names including Location of perceiver, or Location of participant; it was even (incorrectly) labelled Place in some frames.
attributes.frequency: Frequency is defined as the number of times the Reveal_secret event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question "how often."

Response(Event).description: An Agent performs a Response action in consequence of a Trigger event. In many cases, a non-agentive Responding_entity causes the Response after the Trigger occurs.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.purpose: An action that the Agent intends to accomplish by performing the Response action.
attributes.dimension: A particular feature of the Responding_entity or Agent that is involved in the Response action.
attributes.role: Role denotes the capacity in which the Interlocutor is judged.
attributes.agent: The intentional Agent that is impinged upon by a Trigger event to which they respond.
attributes.time: The point in time when the Agent or Responding_entity manifests its Response to the Trigger .
attributes.manner: A characterization of the Responding_entity, Agent, or their Response action.
attributes.responding_entity: A non-agentive entity that is impinged upon by a Trigger event to which they respond.
attributes.place: The location in which the Response action takes place.
attributes.response: The means action whereby the Agent responds to the Trigger.
attributes.trigger: An event that impinges upon the Agent or Responding_entity and produces a Response from it.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by the Speaker responds to the Proposal .  Others, I would say have actually turned me down by not replying and not responding.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of response events.
attributes.medium: As with Medium in other Communication frames, the physical entity or channel used to communicate can be expressed, usually as a PP Complement headed by "on" or "in".
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the success or failure logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the success or  failure, but not in all cases.
attributes.group: The Group is the set of people within which the Respond_to_proposal is occuring.
attributes.internal_cause: The response may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an Internal_cause, the Speaker mental or emotional state.
attributes.depictive: Depictive phrase describing the Speaker.
attributes.speaker: The Speaker is the person who communicates the reply or response.
attributes.interlocutor: This is the person who made the Proposal to the Speaker and to whom the Speaker communicates  their response. This frame element stands in for the Proposal and is only licensed when the Proposal  can be understood from the context.
attributes.proposal: The Proposal is the prior communication or action to which a response is given.
attributes.iterations: The frame element Iterations is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.

Court_examination(Event).description: A Questioner asks a Witness (or defendant) questions in the context of a court procedure.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.purpose: The Purpose of the examination.
attributes.questioner: The individual who asks a Witness questions.
attributes.time: When the examination occurs.
attributes.means: The Means by which the Questioner examines the Witness.
attributes.duration: How long the examination takes place.
attributes.topic: The subject matter to which the examination pertains.
attributes.witness: A person who is present in a courtroom in order to give some form of evidence, has been sworn in, and is being examined by a Questioner.
attributes.manner: The Manner in which the Questioner examines the Witness.
attributes.place: Where the examination takes place.

Scrutiny(Event).description: This frame concerns a Cognizer (a person or other intelligent being) paying close attention to something, the Ground, in order to discover and note its salient characteristics.  The Cognizer may be interested in a particular characteristic or entity, the Phenomenon, that belongs to the Ground or is contained in the Ground (or to ensure that such a property of entity is not present).

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.degree: This FE identifies the Degree to which the Cognizer scrutinizes the Ground.
attributes.medium: The Medium is the piece of text or work in which the Cognizer pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The FE is normally expressed as an External Argument:
attributes.cognizer: The Cognizer pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it.
attributes.instrument: An entity directed by the Cognizer  that interacts with the Ground to accomplish the scrutiny.
attributes.means: The action of the Cognizer which allows them to scrutinize the Ground.
attributes.purpose: The event that the Cognizer hopes to bring about by looking for the Phenomenon.
attributes.phenomenon: The entity that the Cognizer is alert for in the Ground.
attributes.manner: This FE identifies the Manner in which the Cognizer scrutinizes the Ground.
attributes.ground: The Cognizer pays attention to the Ground, so named because it serves as the background or context for the Phenomenon.
attributes.direction: Direction is used for all path-like expressions, except those indicating the location of the perceiver, that describe how the perceiver's attention is directed during the act of perception.
attributes.time: The Time when the Inspector examines the Ground.
attributes.location_of_protagonist: This FE is the position of the Perceiver during the act of perception.  Typically, it is expressed in a from-PP.
attributes.unwanted_entity: An entity whose presence would impair the acceptability or usefulness of the Ground.
attributes.desired_state_of_affairs: The desirable state of affairs which the Inspector hopes to find to obtain when inspecting the Ground.
attributes.circumstances: The circumstances under which the Inspector examines the Ground.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
attributes.inspector: The person who inspects the Ground to see if it is intact or without blemish.

Lighting(Event).description: An Emitter emits a Beam of light from a Source, along a Path, and/or towards a Goal.  Essentially, this frame denotes the (semi-)fictive motion of the the Beam.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.emitter: This FE identifies the entity at the Source from which the Beam originates.
attributes.path: Path refers to where the Beam travels over or to a landmark the Beam travels by.
attributes.source: The Source is the location the Beam occupies initially before its change of location.
attributes.degree: Degree to which the light movement occurs
attributes.result: Result of an event
attributes.beam: The light that travels from a Source along a Path to a Goal.
attributes.goal: Goal is the location the Beam ends up in.
attributes.manner: Manner of performing an action
attributes.depictive: Depictive phrase describing the external argument.

Criminal_investigation(Event).description: This frame describes the process that involves the inquiry and determination by an authority, the Investigator, of the circumstances surrounding an Incident perpetrated by a Suspect.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.incident: The Investigator attempts to determine the exact circumstances surrounding the Incident, which is typically a criminal act (murder, robbery) or the result of such an act (death, loss of money).
attributes.time: When the Investigator investigates the Incident.
attributes.suspect: This FE denotes the Suspect that is investigated by the Investigator.
attributes.duration: The length of the investigation.
attributes.investigator: The Investigator is the person or agency that investigates the Suspect of a crime (Incident).

Hiding_objects(Event).description: An Agent causes a Hidden_object to become perceptually inaccessible to potential perceivers by placing it in a Hiding_place or putting in place an Obstruction that screens the object.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.obstruction: The entity that the Agent uses to block the Hidden_object from being perceptible.
attributes.agent: The Agent is the person who causes the Hidden_entity to be not perceptually accessible to potential perceivers.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the occurrence of the hiding event logically follows.
attributes.potential_observer: The Potential_observer denotes a person who might perceive the Hidden_object if it was not hidden.
attributes.purpose: The state-of-affairs that the Agent hopes to bring about by hiding the Hidden_object.
attributes.place: The Place is the spatial setting in which the hiding event takes place.
attributes.means: An action of the Agent that brings about the hiding of the Hidden_object.
attributes.time: Time denotes the interval of time during which the Agent causes the Hidden_object to become hidden from perceptual access.
attributes.hiding_place: The location in which the Hidden_object is placed so as not to be perceptually accessible.
attributes.hidden_object: The Hidden_object is the entity which is blocked from view.
attributes.degree: The extent to which the Hidden_object becomes perceptually inaccessible.
attributes.manner: Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).

Confronting_problem(Event).description: An Agent becomes involved in an Issue which has negative consequences for them. The Agent will normally respond to resolve the Issue.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the reason why the Agent confronts the issue.
attributes.agent: The Agent is the person who is acting to deal with the Issue.
attributes.explanation: Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the state of affairs expressed by the target, but not in all cases.
attributes.domain: The Domain within which the Agent acts.
attributes.frequency: The Frequency with which the Agent does the Act in a given period of time.
attributes.period_of_iterations: The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.
attributes.issue: This FE identifies the Issue that the Agent deals with.
attributes.manner: Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.event_description: This FE gives a description of the confronting event as a whole.
attributes.time: The time at which the Activity takes place.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the Place where the intentional act occurs.
attributes.result: The Result describes the resulting outcome of the confronting act.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the way in which an Agent goes about facing the Issue.
attributes.activity: This Frame Element marks expressions indicating the Activity that the Experiencer finds difficult or easy. In many cases, the relevant Activity has to be inferred from the context.
attributes.experiencer: This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate which person judges carrying out the Activity to be easy or difficult.
attributes.parameter: This FE marks expressions that indicate a respect in which the Activity is judged easy or difficult to carry out by the Experiencer.
attributes.circumstances: This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate a set of conditions in which the Activity is being experienced and which influence the Experiencer's perception of how easy or difficult the Activity is.
attributes.standard: The experience of the Activity by the Experiencer may be compared to a Standard situation, which may be evoked either as an event or state, or by reference to a salient participant.
attributes.degree: This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the Degree of difficulty that the Experiencer has in carrying out the Activity.

Renting(Event).description: A Lessee gains the use of Goods owned by a Lessor by payment to the Lessor.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.lessor: The individual who has permanent ownership of the Goods and allows them to be used by the Lessee temporarily.
attributes.duration: The length of time that the Goods are (or have been) in the Lessee's possession.
attributes.money: Money is the thing given in exchange for tempory use of the Goods.
attributes.lessee: The individual that gains temporary use of the Goods by paying the Lessor
attributes.manner: Any description of the purchasing event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Lessee that affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). She quit her old job and gleefully leased a cheap, Upper East Side apartment.
attributes.unit: This FE is any unit in which goods or services can be measured.
attributes.means: The means by which a commercial transaction occurs.
attributes.time: When the event occurs.
attributes.recipient: The individual intended by the Lessee to receive the Goods.
attributes.rate: In isome cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods.
attributes.imposed_purpose: The Lessee's intended purpose for the Goods.
attributes.explanation: A state-of-affairs from which the renting logically follows.
attributes.purpose: The purpose for which the renting is performed.
attributes.goods: The FE Goods is an item which is temporarily exchanged for Money in a transaction.
attributes.place: The location the renting takes place.

Breathing(Event).description: An Agent causes Air to move in a direction, usually specifying either in or out of the body.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.time: The time at which breathing occurs.
attributes.internal_cause: This FE designates internal events/states that cause the Agent to exhibit the specified type of breathing. Further, the internal state of the Agent is perceivable to others because of the breathing event.
attributes.degree: This FE identifies the degree to which an Agent is breathing.
attributes.distance: The distance that the Air travels.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the Place where the breathing occurs.
attributes.source: Source identifies the starting point of the Air.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances are expressions indicating prevailing physical conditions or states of affairs concurrent  to the breathing event.
attributes.manner: This FE identifies the Manner in which an Agent breathes.
attributes.air: Air is the substance that the Agent causes to move.
attributes.path: This FE identifies the Path of the motion through locations after leaving the Source and before reaching the Goal.  Lee breathed through his mouth.
attributes.external_cause: This FE denotes an event or state external to the Agent that causes them exhibit the specified manner of breathing but not as a conscious response to the External_cause.
attributes.instrument: An entity that allows the Agent to breathe, either a natural part (the lungs, say) or a device (like a respirator).
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means of breathing.
attributes.depictive: Depictive identifies a  phrase describing a participant in a breathing event.
attributes.agent: The Agent's breathing causes the motion of the Air.  Agent is generally the External Argument.
attributes.duration: This FE idenitfies the Duration of time that an Agent breathes.
attributes.purpose: An action that the Agent intends to accomplish by breathing in the specified manner.
attributes.goal: This FE identifies the point at which the Air ends up as a result of the motion. Lee breathed into Ann's mouth.

Patrolling(Event).description: An individual or group, the Patrol moves through and examines a Ground in order to ensure that it is in a generally Desired_state_of_affairs, particularly that it is safe and contains no dangerous Unwanted_entity. Rather than moving through the Ground, the Patrol may simply move such that all the (relevant portions of) Ground can be observed and checked.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.degree: This FE identifies the extent  to which the Patrol examines the Ground.
attributes.vehicle: The Patrol may move around in a Vehicle.
attributes.desired_state_of_affairs: The desirable state of affairs which the Patrol hopes to ensure by visiting Ground.
attributes.purpose: The desired outcome of the patrolling. Normally this constituent is a PP Complement headed by for, or a to-marked VP Complement.
attributes.circumstances: The circumstances under which the Patrol examines the Ground.
attributes.ground: The area that the Patrol inspects with to ensure its safety.
attributes.possessor: The Possessor is the organization (usually a nation or group of nations) that orchestrates the patrol.
attributes.patrol: The person (or group) who inspects the Ground to see that it is safe.
attributes.means: This FE is used for the Means by which the Patrol examines  the Ground.
attributes.manner: This FE identifies the Manner in which the Patrol inspects the Ground.
attributes.instrument: An entity used by the Patrol to scrutinize the Ground.
attributes.co-participant: The Co-participant patrols along with the Patrol.
attributes.descriptor: A description of one of the participants in the patrolling event.
attributes.time: >The Time when the Patrol examines the Ground.
attributes.members: An indication of the members of the patrol.
attributes.duration: The length of time of the patrol.
attributes.unwanted_entity: An entity whose presence would impair the desirability or safety of the Ground.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
attributes.location_of_protagonist: This FE is the position of the Patrol during the act of perception.  Typically, it is expressed in a from-PP.

Arrest(Event).description: Authorities charge a Suspect, who is under suspicion of having committed a crime (the Charges), and take him/her into custody.The police arrested Harry on charges of manslaughter.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.authorities: The Authorities hold the Prisoner in custody.
attributes.manner: Any description of the state of being captive which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Theme.
attributes.charges: This FE identifies the crime with which the Suspect is charged.
attributes.co-participant: A person that participates in the event along with the Authorities or the Suspect.
attributes.time: The Time when the Theme is held captive.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the general Place where the Theme is held captive.
attributes.source_of_legal_authority: The Source_of_legal_authority describe the law which grants the power of arrest to the Authorities.
attributes.type: This FE indicates the subtype of arrest under which the Suspect is placed.
attributes.suspect: This FE identifies the person who is taken into custody and held, under suspicion of having committed a crime.
attributes.purpose: The purpose of the imprisonment.
attributes.offense: The action that the Prisoner is being punished for.
attributes.means: An intentional action performed by the Authorities that brings about the imprisonment.
attributes.legal_basis: This FE identifies the law, act, or precedent that allows the Authorities
attributes.duration: This FE identifies the Duration of time for which the Theme remains in captivity.
attributes.dependent_state: This FE identifies the state of the Suspect being held. Snake was held in communicado.
attributes.holding_location: The area within which the Theme is confined.
attributes.explanation: The reason for which the Theme is held captive.
attributes.prisoner: The Prisoner is held in custody as a punishment for having committed a crime.
attributes.iterations: Iterations marks expressions that indicate the number of times the Prisoner was imprisoned.
attributes.prison: The facility where the Prisoner is held.
attributes.conviction: The legal classification which characterizes the Offense.
attributes.crime: The crime of which the Prisoner is guilty, resulting in imprisonment.
attributes.theme: The entity which is confined.
attributes.cause: An inanimate force which causes the Theme in be unable to move.
attributes.agent: The Agent prevents the Theme from moving.

Convincing(Event).description: A Speaker succeeds in getting an Addressee to believe or plan to execute the Content the Speaker has in mind. In most cases, the information is related to some course of action for the Addressee, and the words of this frame imply that the Addressee has formed an intention to act consistently with the Content. There is no implication that the Addressee actually acts upon the intention formed. In the case of convince and persuade, the act that the Speaker wishes the Addressee to perform can be the adoption of a belief, which may be expressed as a that-clause or as an of-PP complement.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.place: The location where the Speaker attemtps susaion on an Addressee.
attributes.time: The time at which the lobbying occurs.
attributes.content: The wish for action on the Addressee's part that the Speaker expresses.
attributes.manner: This FE identifies the Manner in which an action is performed.
attributes.addressee: The person that the Speaker seeks to influence to act.
attributes.text: A piece of written or spoken material that changes the mind of the Addressee.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by which an action is performed.
attributes.speaker: The person who intends through the use of language to get another person to act.
attributes.degree: This FE identifies the Degree to which an event occurs.
attributes.group: The Group is the set of Speakers and Mediums within which the Attempt_suasion is occuring.
attributes.role: The role in which the Salient_entity is used to try to persuade the Addressee.
attributes.period_of_iterations: The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.
attributes.re-encoding: This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame.
attributes.depictive: Depictive identifies a phrase that describes the actor of an action.
attributes.purpose: The reason for which the Speaker attempts to persuade the Addressee.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.
attributes.medium: The written or spoken material that contains a message that potentially influences the Addressee towards the Content.
attributes.salient_entity: An entity which the Speaker believes should participate in the action.
attributes.circumstances: The state of the world (independent of the event).
attributes.frequency: This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often.

Commerce_sell(Event).description: These are words describing basic commercial transactions involving a buyer and a seller exchanging money and goods, taking the perspective of the seller.  The words vary individually in the patterns of frame element realization they allow. For example, the typical patterns for SELL: SELLER sells GOODS to BUYER for MONEY.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.means: The Means by which a commercial transaction occurs.
attributes.imposed_purpose: The Buyer's intended purpose for the Goods.
attributes.place: Where the event takes place.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation for which an event occurs.
attributes.purpose: The Purpose for which an intentional act is performed.
attributes.buyer: The Buyer has the Money and wants the Goods.
attributes.result: The state of the Seller after the sale has occurred.
attributes.period_of_iterations: The length of time from when the commerce event began to be repeated to when it stopped.
attributes.relay: This FE indicates that the selling act constitues a re-selling by the current Seller of  Goods that they bought earlier from a third person who is not the Buyer of the current selling act.
attributes.back: This FE indicates that the selling act reverses an earlier separate act in which the current Seller bought the Goods from the current Buyer.
attributes.money: Money is the thing given in exchange for Goods in a transaction.
attributes.goods: The FE Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction.
attributes.seller: The Seller has possession of the Goods and exchanges them for Money from a Buyer.
attributes.unit: This FE is any unit in which goods or services can be measured.
attributes.manner: Any description of the selling event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Seller that affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.rate: In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods.
attributes.time: When the event occurs.

Cure(Event).description: This frame deals with a Healer treating and curing an Affliction (the injuries, disease, or pain) of the Patient, sometimes also mentioning the use of a particular Treatment or Medication. This frame differs from Medical_intervention in that this frame deals only with cases in which the Patient is cured of the Affliction, not just treated for the Affliction.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.manner: Manner of performing an action
attributes.duration: The period of time that the Patient recieves the Treatment.
attributes.reciprocation: The Reason for which an intentional act is performed.
attributes.place: Where the event takes place.
attributes.body_part: The Body_part is the specific area of the Patient's body which is treated.
attributes.time: When the event occurs.
attributes.medication: The injested, applied, injected, etc. substance designed to cure the Patient.
attributes.affliction: The Frame Element Affliction is generally the NP Object of a verb, frequently incorporating the Patient as a possessor, as described above:
attributes.purpose: The purpose for which an intentional act is performed.
attributes.healer: The  Healer, anyone who treats or cures the Patient, occurs as the External Argument of verbs: Doctors alleviated his suffering.
attributes.degree: Degree to which event occurs
attributes.patient: This   is the sufferer of the injury, disease or pain and can occur as an NP Object in this frame. However, Patient may not be expressed as a separate Frame Element but frequently occurs as the possessor of the Affliction, an example of  FE Conflation:  (See section on Conflation.)
attributes.treatment: The FE Treatment is used for treatments and means, distinguished by separate FEs in FN-1.

Temporary_stay(Event).description: A Guest stays for a time at a Location, which is not his or her permanent residence, for some Duration. The Location is often the permanent residence of a Host.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.location: The Location where the Guest spends a short amount of time.
attributes.host: The Host is living at the Location on a permanent basis, and is allowing the Guest to stay there.
attributes.co-participant: Another person who, along with the Guest, is temporarily living at the Location.
attributes.frequency: The average number of times the event occurs over a period.
attributes.guest: The Guest remains for a relatively short period of time in the Location.
attributes.means: An action of the Guest that brings about their ability to stay at the Location.
attributes.containing_event: This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time of the temporary stay, and which is taken to be a part of the stay.
attributes.manner: Any description of the type of event by comparison to other events (the same way) or by characterizing a state of the Guest that affects the action.
attributes.time: The time at which the temporary stay takes place.
attributes.descriptor: A description of one of the participants in the temporary stay, or of the staying state-of-affairs in general.
attributes.duration: The length of time that the Guest remains at the Location.
attributes.explanation: A state of affairs that provides an explanation for the temporary stay.
attributes.place: The Place indicates the larger physical setting of the temporary stay.
attributes.purpose: The activity that the Guest hopes to achieve by the stay.
attributes.iterations: The number of times that the event occurs.

Dispersal(Event).description: An Agent or a Cause disperses or scatters Individuals from the Source,a relatively confined space, to a the Goal_area, a broader space.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.speed: The rate of motion of the Individuals, usually in terms of how long it takes for them to leave the Source and end up in the Goal_area.
attributes.manner: Any description of the dispersing event  which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously),  secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). With agentive uses, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (eagerly, carefully).
attributes.explanation: A state of affairs that the Agent is responding to in dispersing the Individuals
attributes.goal_area: Goal_area identifies the broader space to which the Agent scatters the Individuals
attributes.cause: An event or force that causes that Individuals to disperse.
attributes.distance: The distance that the Individuals move from their original location, the Source.
attributes.time: The Time when the Individuals are dispersed.
attributes.individuals: The Individuals are scattered by the Agent.
attributes.place: The Place where the dispersing event happens.
attributes.agent: The Agent disperses or scatters the Individuals.
attributes.means: An intentional action performed by the Agent that accomplishes the dispersal.
attributes.source: Source is the relatively confined space from which an Agent scatters the Individuals.
attributes.result: A state of the Individuals that results from the dispersal.
attributes.path: The trajectory along which the Individuals move.

Collaboration(Event).description: Partner_1 and Partner_2 or a group of Partners  work together in some Undertaking. The Partners are taken to be of equal status even when expressed disjointly.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the time when the Partners are engaged in their collaboration.
attributes.partner_1: When the parties in a collaboration are expressed separately, this Frame Element marks constituents that express the one that is grammatically more prominent, i.e., the one that is the subject of an active clause.
attributes.partners: This frame element marks expressions that express the parties that work together in an Undertaking.
attributes.manner: This FE identifies the Manner in which Partner_1 collaborates with Partner_2 or in which the Partners collaborate.
attributes.partner_2: This Frame element marks constituents expressing the grammatically  less prominent, typically oblique, party in a collaboration.
attributes.means: The action taken by the Partners that lets them accomplish the collaboration.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the Place where the collaboration occurs.
attributes.degree: This FE marks expressions that indicate to what extent the Partners are cooperating.
attributes.undertaking: This frame element marks constituents that express the project in which the Partners are collaborating.
attributes.duration: This FE identifies the amount of time the Partners collaborate.

Extradition(Event).description: A Suspect in a Current_jurisdiction is forced by Authorities (of the Current_jurisdiction) to go to the Crime_jurisdiction, i.e. the jurisdiction which requested that the Suspect be handed over for trial for a crime which he or she is suspected to have committed in the Crime_jurisdiction.  The purpose or reason for the extradition may also be expressed.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.purpose: The Purpose for which the Authorities extradite the Suspect.
attributes.time: The time at which  the Suspect is moved.
attributes.authorities: The Authorities act on behalf of the Current_jurisdiction, giving up the Suspect to the Crime_jurisdiction.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation for which the Authorities extradite the Suspect.
attributes.legal_basis: This FE indicates the basis in law of an extradition.
attributes.crime_jurisdiction: The jurisdiction (generally a nation) to which the Suspect is sent.
attributes.means: The act of the Authorities which brings about the transfer from the Current_jurisdiction to the Crime_jurisdiction.
attributes.manner: A description of the manner of the extradition.
attributes.depictive: A description of the Authorities or Suspect during the extradition.
attributes.place: The location where the extradition occurs.
attributes.current_jurisdiction: The jurisdiction (generally a nation) the Suspect starts off in.
attributes.suspect: The Suspect is forced to go to the jurisdiction where a crime he or she is suspected of took place or is being tried.

Change_sentiment(Event).description: An Agent intentionally seeks to bring about an internal mental or emotional state in the Experiencer.  This frame in closely related to  Experiencer_obj.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.degree: Degree to which the Experiencer ends up feeling an emotion.
attributes.agent: The Agent is an External Argument of the target word and purposefully arouses an emotional state.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the Place where the Agent affects the Experiencer
attributes.instrument: This FE identifies the Instrument with which the Agent brings about the emotional state.
attributes.experiencer: The Experiencer is the person the Agent causes to have a particular emotional state.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the Purpose for which an Agent brings about the emotional state in the Experiencer.
attributes.resulting_action: What the Agent intends to make the Experiencer do by causing a certain experience and the Experiencer actually does.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by which the Agent intentionally tries to bring about an internal mental or emotional state.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the Time when the Agent affects the Experiencer.
attributes.manner: This Frame Element is for expressions that elaborate the manner in which the Agent affects the Experiencer.

Commitment(Event).description: A Speaker makes a commitment to an Addressee to carry out some future action.  This may be an action desirable (as with promise) or not desirable (as with threaten) to the Addressee. Some of the words in this frame allow an Addressee to be expressed.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.purpose: An action that the Speaker intends to accomplish by taking on the commitment.
attributes.topic: Topic expressions are not very frequent in this frame. They can occur with noun targets. Jo made endless promises about working harder at school.
attributes.time: The time period during which the Speaker makes the commitment.
attributes.period_of_iterations: This FE is used to indicate length of time from when Commitment event began to be repeated to when it stopped.
attributes.medium: As with other frames in the Communication domain, the Medium of communication may be expressed. Medium is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the Message. Bob threatened the workers in Spanish.
attributes.addressee: The Speaker's commitment can be made to an Addressee.  With those words which allow this frame element to be expressed, Addressee usually occurs as a PP Complement headed by to or the (Indirect) Object of verbs: Kim made a promise to me. Kim promised me that everything would be okay.
attributes.manner: The Manner in which the commitment is made.
attributes.speaker: The Speaker is the person who commits him/herself to do something.  Speaker is usually the External Argument of predicative uses of the target or the Genitive modifier of a noun: Jo made a promise to me. Jo promised me she would cook dinner. Jo's promise to cook dinner came to nothing.
attributes.place: The location in which the Speaker makes the commitment.
attributes.message: An expression of the commitment made by the Speaker expresses the frame element Message.  Message is expressed as a finite or non-finite clausal Complement or an NP Object: I swore that I would never make the same mistake again. The owner finally consented to sell the business. They threatened revenge.

Commerce_pay(Event).description: This frame involves Buyers paying Money for Goods.  In this frame the Money is the direct object, and is mapped to the theme of the transfer.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.seller: The Seller has the Goods and wants the Money.
attributes.money: Money is the thing given in exchange for Goods in a transaction.
attributes.unit: This FE is any unit in which goods or services can be measured.
attributes.place: Where the event takes place.
attributes.frequency: This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.
attributes.purpose: The Purpose for which an intentional act is performed.
attributes.means: The Means by which a commercial transaction occurs.
attributes.time: When the event occurs.
attributes.rate: In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods.
attributes.buyer: The Buyer has the Money and wants the Goods.
attributes.goods: The FE Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation for which an event occurs.
attributes.manner: Any description of the paying event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Buyer that affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.

Filling(Event).description: These are words relating to filling containers and covering areas with some thing, things or substance, the Theme. The area or container can appear as the direct object with all these verbs, and is designated Goal because it is the goal of motion of the Theme. Corresponding to its nuclear argument status, it is also affected in some crucial way, unlike goals in other frames.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.agent: The Agent is the actor who instigates the filling.
attributes.means: The Means by which the filling occurs.
attributes.cause: An event which brings about the filling of the Goal.
attributes.depictive: Depictive phrase describing the Agent of the filling action.
attributes.theme: The Theme is the physical object or substance which changes location. Rev. Lovejoy carefully brushed the rolls with butter.
attributes.instrument: The Instrument with which the filling occurs.
attributes.place: Where the filling takes place.
attributes.goal: The Goal is the area or container being filled. Goal is generally the NP Object in this frame.
attributes.source: The Source is the location where the Theme begins its motion. Josef filled his flask from the whiskey bottle.
attributes.path: The Path is the trajectory of the motion.  Jess filled the container through a small hole in the lid.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation for which the Agent fills or covers the Goal. Samantha covered the table with flowers because she was bored.
attributes.manner: The Manner in which the filling occurs.
attributes.time: When the filling occurs.
attributes.degree: Degree to which the filling occurs.
attributes.purpose: The purpose for which the Agent fills the Goal. Samantha covered the table with flowers to please her mother.
attributes.subregion: The Subregion is the smaller area of the Goal where the filling or covering occurs. Mrs. Bouvier anointed the children with oil on the forehead.
attributes.result: The Result is the resultant state after the filling has occurred.

Becoming(Event).description: An Entity ends up with some Final_quality--a new fact about the Entity. Alternatively, based on a cluster of changes of characteristics, the Entitynewly meets the conditions for being a member of a Final_category.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.entity: The Entity which undergoes a change, newly ending up in the Final_category or taking on a new Final_quality.
attributes.duration_of_final_state: How long the Entity remains in the Final_category, Final_situation, or Final_quality.
attributes.manner: Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In cases where the Entity is intentional, Manner may indicate salient characteristics of an intentional Entity that also affect the event (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.place: Where the change takes place.
attributes.transitional_period: The period during which the Entity is in transition.
attributes.group: A description of the kind of entities associated with instances of the Entity and saliently affected by its change.
attributes.final_category: The category that the Entity ends up in after the change.  Typically, this entails taking on a number of new characteristics.
attributes.explanation: Any eventuality or entity which brings about the change of the Entity.
attributes.time: >When the change occurs.
attributes.initial_state: This FE describes the state of the Entity before change occurs.
attributes.circumstances: This FE marks the set of conditions under which the Entity enters the Final_category or takes on the characteristic of the Final_quality.
attributes.initial_category: This FE describes the category of the Entity before a change.
attributes.final_quality: A description of a characteristic of the Entity after the change.

Achieve(Event).description: After a period in which the Agent has been working on a Goal, the Agent manages to attain it.  The Goal may be a desired state, or be conceptualized as an event.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
attributes.agent: The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional act that fulfills the Goal.
attributes.degree: The extent to which the Agent achieves the Goal.
attributes.circumstances: Some specification of the circumstances under which Goal is accomplished.
attributes.outcome: The Outcome is the failure or success of accomplishing  a Goal.
attributes.instrument: An entity directed by the Agent that allows them to achieve their Goal.
attributes.goal: The state or action that the Agent has wished to participate in.
attributes.explanation: A state-of-affairs from which the accomplishment would be predicted.
attributes.domain: The particular aspect or domain of the Goal that is achieved.
attributes.means: An intentional action performed by the Agent that lets them accomplish their Goal.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the place where the Agent achieves their Goal.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the time when the Agent achieves their Goal.
attributes.duration: The length of time that it takes for Goal to be accomplished.
attributes.manner: Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).

Practice(Event).description: An Agent enacts an Action that is intended to be performed again at one or more later Occasions.  The goal of practicing is to ensure that the action at the later Occasion(s) comes off flawlessly.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.occasion: The later enactment or enactments that the Agent expects to perform. Note that the Agent does not have to have specific Occasions in mind.  For our brother's wedding we had to rehearse the dinner twenty times.
attributes.co-participant: A person who participates in a practice event along with the Agent.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the place where the practicing occurs.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the purpose for which an Agent performs an intentional act.
attributes.action: This FE identifies the Action that the Agent performs intentionally in order to prepare for a later Occasion.
attributes.duration: The period of time during which an Action is repeatedly practiced.
attributes.iterations: The number of times that the Action is practiced.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the time when the Agent practices.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by which an Agent  practices.
attributes.agent: The Agent performs the Action in preparation for later performances of the same type.
attributes.manner: Any description of the practicing which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the Action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).

Cause_change_of_strength(Event).description: An Agent causes a Patient to be more strong, often resulting in something that is more secure and safe.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.agent: The Agent fortifies the Patient.
attributes.manner: Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.cause: An event which causes the Patient to become stronger.
attributes.result: The resultant state of the action.
attributes.means: An act performed by an Agent that enables them to act upon the Patient.
attributes.place: The location at which the Agent fortifies the Patient.
attributes.depictive: Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action
attributes.patient: The Patient is the entity that is being made stronger.
attributes.time: The time at which the Agent makes the Patient stronger.
attributes.containing_event: This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which
attributes.circumstances: The  Circumstances of the world at the time of the event (which do not bear directly on the event itself).
attributes.degree: This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.
attributes.frequency: This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.

Supply(Event).description: A Supplier gives a Theme to a Recipient to fulfill a need or purpose (Imposed_purpose) of the Recipient.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.place: The Place where the Supplier gives the Theme to the Recipient.
attributes.imposed_purpose: The Recipient's intended purpose for the Theme.
attributes.time: The Time is when the Supplier gives the Theme to the Recipient.
attributes.manner: Any description of the supplying event  which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously),  secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Supplier that affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.purpose: The Purpose for which the Supplier gives the Theme to the Recipient.
attributes.means: The Means by which the Supplier acquires or gives the Theme to the Recipient.
attributes.theme: The object that is given to the Recipient .
attributes.cotheme: An additional theme which is supplied along with the main Theme.
attributes.source: The source of the Theme.
attributes.period_of_iterations: The period over which the Supplier engages in (multiple) supplying acts.
attributes.supplier: The person that begins in possession of the Theme and causes it to be in the possession of the Recipient.  I approve of your having supplied him with a file of soldiers.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation for which the Supplier gives the Theme to the Recipient.
attributes.recipient: The entity that ends up in possession of the Theme.
attributes.circumstances: The Circumstances are the conditions under which the Theme is supplied.

Cause_to_amalgamate(Event).description: These words refer to an Agent joining Parts to form a Whole.  (The Parts may also be encoded as Part_1 and Part_2.)  There is a symmetrical relationship between the components that undergo the process, and afterwards the Parts are consumed and are no longer distinct entities that are easily discernable or separable in the Whole.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.part_2: This FE identifies the second of two Parts mentioned. It is usually a PP Complement.
attributes.parts: This FE identifies the Parts entities being combined, and is often expressed in a single plural NP, usually the direct object of a verb. Chuck merged the corpora into a database.The directors merged the two companies into a conglomerate.
attributes.manner: This FE identifies the Manner in which the amalgamating occurs.
attributes.place: The location that the event occurs.
attributes.purpose: The state of affairs that the Agent seeks to bring about by the Amalgamation.
attributes.time: The time at which the amalgamation occurs.
attributes.whole: This  FE identifies Whole as the entity resulting from combination of Parts.  When overtly expressed, it is usually a PP Complement (often headed by into).Chuck merged the corpora into a database. The directors merged the two companies into a conglomorate.
attributes.part_1: This FE identifies the first of two Parts mentioned. It  is most often the NP-Object of a verb.
attributes.degree: This FE identifies the thoroughness of the mixing job, i.e. to what degree the resulting Whole is undifferentiated.
attributes.agent: In causative uses of these verbs there is an Agent responsible for amalgamating the Parts. The Agent is generally the External Argument (or the object of a PP-by in passives).The chef combined the ingredients.The ingredients were combined by the chef.
attributes.depictive: The state of the Parts during the amalgamation.  Often it refers to the proportion of the Parts to one another.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by which the amalgamating occurs.
attributes.result: This FE  is used for indicating the Result of amalgamating.

Scouring(Event).description: A Searcher looks all over a Ground in order to find a Sought_entity. The Sought_entity is not presupposed to exist. The search activity is not concerned with the state of the Ground, which is the case in the Inspecting frame, but only with the finding of the Sought_entity, which is desirable.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.ground: The location that the Searcher covers in looking for the Sought_entity.
attributes.purpose: The state-of-affairs that the Searcher hopes to bring about by searching a Ground.
attributes.instrument: An entity manipulated by the Searcher to examine the Ground.
attributes.sought_entity: The entity that the Searcher wants to find.
attributes.searcher: The person who is looking all over the Ground for the Sought_entity.
attributes.degree: This FE identifies the Degree to which the Searcher scrutinizes the Ground.
attributes.time: The Time when the Searcher scoures the Ground.
attributes.manner: This FE identifies the Manner in which the Searcher scrutinizes the Ground.
attributes.means: The action of the Searcher that allows them to search the Ground.
