attributes.duration: This FE specifies the length of the interval during which the scouring activtiy takes place.

Violence(Event).description: The words in this frame describe acts (or situations characterized by acts) that cause injury or harm. The acts may involve an Aggressor or Cause injuring a Victim, or Aggressors causing each other harm.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.iterations: Iterations refers to the number of times the violent act occurs.
attributes.place: Place identifies the place where the violence occurs.
attributes.victim: The Victim is the being or entity that is injured.
attributes.purpose: Purpose identifies the purpose for which a harm-causing action is carried out.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the violent event and any of its participants.
attributes.instrument: This FE is any object used to cause the injury.
attributes.degree: Degree is the degree to which violence is done.
attributes.aggressors: The Aggressors commit acts of violence upon each other.
attributes.explanation: A fact or action related to one of the participants in the volient act that the Aggressor responds to in doing violence.
attributes.manner: The Manner in which the Aggressor acts upon the Victim.
attributes.aggressor: The Aggressor is the person causing the Victim's injury.
attributes.means: An intentional action performed by the Aggressor that results in the committing of a violent act.
attributes.containing_event: This FE identifies the event in which the harm is caused.
attributes.frequency: How often the violence occurs.
attributes.time: Time identifies the time when the harm-causing event occurs.
attributes.cause: The Cause marks expressions that indicate some non-intentional, typically non-human, force that inflicts harm on the Victim

Reforming_a_system(Event).description: Because it no longer functions adequately under the given circumstances, an Agent (or non-Agentive Cause) undertakes steps to change the structural makeup of a complex Entity with interdependent parts, for instance an institution or a system of laws. The Degree of change is typically gradual and partial rather than revolutionary and total. Note that with some LUs the Entity can be unexpressed when it is identical to the Agent.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.degree: The extent to which the Entity differs from its former state at the end of the reform.
attributes.event_description: This FE is used for phrases that describe the event of reforming as a whole .
attributes.place: The place where the reformation occurs.
attributes.agent: The sentient entity that effects a change in the Entity.
attributes.purpose: An action that the Agent intends to accomplish by effecting a change in the Entity.
attributes.re-encoding: An alternative description of expressed action
attributes.entity: This FE denotes a complex, abstract, human-created entity with interdependent parts which has either deteriorated or is no longer adequate for its purpose given a change in circumstances and which the Agent therefore wants to modify.
attributes.initial_category: The category of which the Entity is a member before the Agent causes a change in its makeup.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which reform event logically follows. In many cases, the state of affairs denoted is specifically one that the Agent takes as a reason for reforming the entity.
attributes.manner: Any description of the  event causing the change of the Entity which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly), general descriptions comparing events (the same way), and salient characteristics of the Agent that also affect the action (carefully).
attributes.cause: This FE is for non-human causes, such as a processes or institutions, responsible for reform.
attributes.circumstances: This FE describes the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the reform process.
attributes.time: The time at which the change of the Entity is caused.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the steps or actions directly enabling reform.
attributes.final_category: The category that the Entity belongs to after it has undergone the change.
attributes.duration: The length of time over which reforming takes place

Come_together(Event).description: This frame describes an Agent's gathering of Individuals (people or entities) into a group, the  Aggregate, defined by relative proximity.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.source: The Source is the location where the Individuals are at the beginning of the gathering event.
attributes.place: The Place is where the congregating occurs.
attributes.co-participant: The Co-participant participates in a coordinated way in the same event as the primary protagonist.
attributes.instrument: An Instrument that the Agent uses to gather the Individuals together.
attributes.time: The Time is when the congregating occurs.
attributes.means: The Means descibes the way in which the Individuals accomplish the congregating.
attributes.purpose: An action that the Configuration plans to engage in upon assembly.
attributes.frequency: How often the Individuals come together to form an Configuration.
attributes.path: The Path is the trajectory of motion that the Individuals take.
attributes.goal: Goal designates the location where the Individuals might end up.
attributes.individuals: The Individuals are self-movers who come together.
attributes.containing_event: This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the Gathering_up event occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.
attributes.aggregate: This FE identifies the aggregate that results from the gathering.  It may be expressed either as an adjunct result phrase or as a direct object of a target verb.
attributes.agent: Agent is the person who gathers Individuals.
attributes.manner: Any description of congregating which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of the Individuals or Configuration that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.
attributes.topic: A Topic of a discussion that may occur between the Individuals.
attributes.iterations: The position in a series of iterations that the current congregating event occupies .
attributes.party_1: Party_1 is the grammatically more prominent participant in the congregating event.
attributes.party_2: A grammatically less prominent participant in the congregating event.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
attributes.configuration: The Configuration describes the resulting formation of the individuals.

Wearing(Event).description: A Wearer puts on an item of Clothing, which then occupies the Body_location.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.clothing: This FE identifies the Clothing that the Wearer wears. Fred was wearing a shirt.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation indicates why the Wearer puts on the Clothing.
attributes.duration: This FE identifies the Duration of the Wearing that results from putting on the Clothing.
attributes.place: The Place indicates where the Donning occurs.
attributes.manner: A characterization of the impression given by the Wearer's clothing status.
attributes.depictive: This FE identifies any Depictive phrase describing the Wearer or Clothing during the act.
attributes.purpose: The state-of-affairs that the Wearer wishes to bring about.
attributes.time: The time at or during which the Wearer has the Clothing on.
attributes.body_location: Body_location identifies the place on the body where the clothing is worn.
attributes.means: The Means is an act whereby the Wearer puts on the Clothing
attributes.wearer: The person whose clothing is under discussion.
attributes.result: This FE identifies the Result of the Placing.
attributes.time_of_creation: The time at which the Creator makes the Garment.
attributes.name: The name given to a specific Garment.  Note this is not the name of a general class of clothing items, but rather an individual item.  This is accordingly VERY RARE.
attributes.style: This FE identifes the design, or cut, of the clothing.
attributes.material: This FE identifes the material from which the clothing is made.
attributes.subregion: This FE identifies a part of the clothing.
attributes.garment: This FE identifes the clothing worn.
attributes.creator: The individual who created the Garment.
attributes.descriptor: This FE identifes any description of the clothing besides Style  and Material.
attributes.use: This FE identifes the Use for which a Garment is worn or was made.
attributes.degree: A characterization of how completely the clothing status holds.
attributes.relative_location: The location relative to the body of the Wearer that the Clothing occupies.  Note that in many cases, the location is defined relative to other clothing.
attributes.body_part: The body part of the Wearer which is covered by the Clothing.
attributes.intended_wearing_location: The location whose characteristics or state the Clothing of the Wearer was intended to suit.  This FE is only possible with wear.v.
attributes.source: NB: This FE will be mapped to Intended_wearing_location

Cause_to_make_progress(Event).description: An Agent works on a Project so that it reaches a more advanced and desirable state.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.post_state: The state of the Project following an advance.
attributes.prior_state: The former state of the Project.
attributes.agent: The individual that brings about the development of the Project.
attributes.rate: The rate at which the change happens.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows.
attributes.duration: The period over which the Agent develops the Project.
attributes.degree: The amount of advancement that the Project has attained.
attributes.manner: A description of the progress, generally a description comparing events (the same way); in addition, it may describe characteristics and states of the Agent that also affect the development.
attributes.project: The object or idea that undergoes change due to the efforts of the Agent.
attributes.means: The action of the Agent which enables the advancement.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the Purpose for which the Agent progresses the Project.
attributes.place: The location at which the the Project progresses.
attributes.time: The time at which the progress occurs.

Legality(Event).description: Words in this frame describe the status of an Action with respect to a Code of laws or rules. An Object may also be in violation or compliance of the Code by virtue of its existence, location or possession.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.action: The Action is the behavior which complies with or violates the Code. Illegal drug use is on the rise.
attributes.object: The Object complies with or violates the Code by virtue of its existence, location or possession.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows.
attributes.code: The Code is the set of rules, laws or regulations that determine whether the Action is allowed or prohibited.

Employment(Event).description: An Employee has a Position doing work in a particular Field, or doing work on a particular Task, for which an Employer gives Compensation to the Employee.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.frequency: How often the Employee works.
attributes.event_description: This FE gives a description of the Being_employed event.
attributes.rank: Rank is the position in a hierarchy that an Employee occupies within the organization of the Employer.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the Time period during which an Employee  works for an Employer.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the Purpose for which an Employee  is in employment.
attributes.employee: The Employee is obligated to perform a Task in order to receive Compensation.
attributes.compensation: The Compensation is the payment that the Employee receives for performing a Task.
attributes.duration: This FE identifies the amount of Time for which the Employee continues being employed.
attributes.employer: The Employer gives Compensation to an Employee.
attributes.type: This FE identifies the Type of the profession.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.
attributes.manner: This FE identifies the Manner in which an Employee works for an Employer.
attributes.place_of_employment: This FE identifies the Place_of_employment of the Employee.
attributes.contract_basis: The Contract_basis describes the conditions of employment with respect to permanency, hours per time period, or payment basis.
attributes.field: This FE identifies the Field in which one works.
attributes.task: The Employee is obligated to perform the Task to recieve Compensation from the Employer .  My dad works building houses.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
attributes.place: The location where the Employee works.
attributes.position: The label given to a particular type of employment.

Rite(Event).description: This frame concerns rituals performed in line with religious beliefs or tradition.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.type: The type of ritual or ceremony being performed.
attributes.leader: This is the religious or cultural leader who performs and/or leads the rite.
attributes.organization: Organization identifies the institution in which the rite is prescribed.
attributes.place: Where the rite takes place.
attributes.manner: Manner of performing the rite
attributes.object: This FE indicates an object on which a rite is performed.
attributes.instrument: This FE identifies the Instrument used to perform a particular rite.
attributes.time: When the rite is performed
attributes.member: The FE Member describes the member of the religious or cultural group who participates in/undergoes the rite.
attributes.new_status: Rites may confer a New_status on a participant (e.g. rank, membership).
attributes.desired_state_of_affairs: This FE identifies the state which the rite is hoped or intended to bring about.
attributes.guardian: The Guardian is the member of the Organization who instigates the rite for someone of which they are a guardian.
attributes.means: The action that is taken to perform the ritual.

Publishing(Event).description: A Publisher makes a Work of an Author (or authors) available to some public Audience for general enjoyment, examination, and reference. The Medium of a Work can vary; examples include books, TV programs, movies, and radio shows. Publication normally involves a number of other events, such as editing and advertising of the Work, and mass production and sales of a represenation of the Work; thus in the most elaborated version of publication, there are a number of other potential roles, such as editor, publicist/advertizer, distributor, printer, etc., but none of these show up as separate, syntactically distinguished roles for the LUs in this frame.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.audience: The subset of the population that the Work is targeted towards or released to.
attributes.place: The location where the Publisher releases the work.
attributes.means: The action taken by the Author or Publisher that makes the Work publicly available.
attributes.author: The person or entity that is responsible for the detailed construction of the content of the Work.  It is normally expressed in place of the Publisher FE, but the Publisher may cooccur with Author, appearing as an adjunct.
attributes.publisher: The entity that acts on behalf of the Author to release the Work to the public.
attributes.medium: The format utilized by the Author to create the Work.
attributes.work: The creation of the Author that is made public by the Publisher.
attributes.manner: Any description of the action that clarifies, in a holistic way, the details of how the publication event unfolded, including comparisons to other events ('the same way') and states of performers of the action that influence the act itself ('peevishly').
attributes.purpose: The situation that the Author or Publisher hopes to bring about by publishing.
attributes.time: The date when the Work is available or is expected to be available.

Adducing(Event).description: A Speaker mentions a Specified_entity filling a Role, thereby providing information which supports a point of the Speaker.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.circumstances: The circumstances under which the adducing takes place.
attributes.speaker: The Speaker is the person who specifies the Role to be filled by the Specified_entity.
attributes.depictive: The state of the Speaker during the statement.
attributes.time: The time when the statement is made.
attributes.specified_entity: The entity that the Speaker identifies as filling a particular Role.
attributes.purpose: An action that the Speaker intends to accomplish by performing the action indicated by adducing the Specified_entity.
attributes.frequency: The number of times an event is occuring (within a period of time).
attributes.role: A slot in a particular or generic event or relation whose filler the Speaker identifies.
attributes.place: The FE specifies the place where the statement takes place.
attributes.containing_event: The event of which the adducing is a part.
attributes.medium: Medium is the physical entity or channel used by the Speaker to transmit the statement.
attributes.means: An act whereby the Speaker makes a statement.
attributes.explanation: The reason for which the Speaker (or Medium) comes to said conclusions about the Specified_entity.
attributes.event_description: In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole.
attributes.addressee: The Addressee is the person to whom the Speaker identifies the filler of a Role.
attributes.manner: Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs,  including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In agentive frames, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).

Exchange(Event).description: Two parties, the Exchangers, each give and receive from the other Themes. The parties are also construable separately as Exchanger_1 and Exchanger_2,  in which case the Themes may be construed separately, too, as Theme_1 and Theme_2.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the place where the exchange occurs.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the purpose for which Exchanger_1 or the Exchangers make the trade.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by which Exchanger_1 or the Exchangers effect the trade.
attributes.theme_1: The item that begins in the possession of Exchanger_1.
attributes.frequency: This frame element denotes how often the Exchangers trade Themes.
attributes.theme_2: The item that begins in the possession of Exchanger_2.
attributes.manner: Any description of the exchange act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of Exchanger_1 or Exchangers that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.depictive: The state of Exchanger_1 or Exchangers during the exchange.
attributes.exchanger_2: In cases where the Exchangers involved in a conversation are
attributes.exchanger_1: In cases where the Exchangers involved in a conversation are
attributes.time: This FE identifies the time when the exchange takes place.
attributes.themes: The items which change possession between the Exchangers.
attributes.exchangers: In some sentences both participants are expressed by the Subject, and there is no 'with'-phrase (cf example 1). In sentences like this, the Subject is assigned the FE role Exchangers. In such sentences, the Subject always denotes more than one person, and it is understood that the reciprocal communication takes place between these two (or more) people. The Subject may denote two or more people either through conjunction, as in example 1, or through plurality, as in example 2, or by denoting a group, as in example 3. In each of these cases the FE Exchangers is assigned. Notice that for nouns in the Exchange frame, it is possible for the Exchangers role to be expressed by a prepositional phrase as in example 4.
attributes.period_of_iterations: The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.

Exchange_currency(Event).description: A Money_owner exchanges Sum_1 in the  Source_currency for Sum_2 in the Target_currency at some Exchange_service.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.exchange_service: The individual or institution which changes the Money_owner's money into the Target_currency.
attributes.sum_2: The amount of money in the Target_currency that the Money_owner receives in exchange for Sum_1.
attributes.means: The action of the Money_owner whereby the exchange is acheived.
attributes.sum_1: An amount of money in the Source_currency that the Money_owner exchanges for an amount in the Target_currency.
attributes.money: Currency that is being exchanged by the Money_owner.
attributes.money_owner: The person who exchanges Sum_1 for Sum_2.
attributes.manner: Any description of the exchange event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of the Money_owner that also affect the action (deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.source_currency: The kind of currency of the Money_owner has before the exchange.
attributes.time: The time when the currency is exchanged.
attributes.place: The location where the money is exchanged.
attributes.target_currency: The kind of currency that the Money_owner receives as part of the exchange.
attributes.purpose: The action that the Money_owner is attempting to accomplish with the exchange.

Ratification(Event).description: A Ratifier responds to a Proposal constructed by another party to make it binding over the Ratifier's jurisdiction or constituency.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.time: The Time is when the Ratifier makes the Proposal binding.
attributes.manner: Any description of the allowing which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of the Ratifier that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.purpose: The Purpose is the goal of the Ratifier when they ratify the Proposal.
attributes.proposal: The idea or course of action proposed by another individual or body which the Ratifier endorses and makes binding.
attributes.means: An action of the Ratifier whereby they make binding the Proposal.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation is the cognitive cause of the Ratifier's ratification.
attributes.place: The Place is where the Ratifier ratifies the Proposal.
attributes.ratifier: The individual or body that confirms a Proposal negotiated or created by another party, causing it to become binding in a jurisdiction represented by the Ratifier.  In the case of direct democratic ratification, the jurisdiction and the Ratifier are the same.

Sign_agreement(Event).description: A Signatory signs an Agreement document, thereby taking on a commitment encoded in the Agreement.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.depictive: An expression of the state of the Signatory at the time of signing.
attributes.role: The category of the Signatory in the Sign_agreement event.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation for putting signature to paper.
attributes.co-participant: The Co-participant signs the Agreement along with the Signatory.
attributes.manner: Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of the Signatory that also affect the action (happily, eagerly).
attributes.time: This FE identifies the Time at which signature is given.
attributes.place: The place where the signing occurs.
attributes.purpose: The purpose for which the Signatory commits to the Agreement.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the action whereby the Signatory achieves the signing of the Agreement.
attributes.beneficiary: his extrathematic FE applies to participants that derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate. Further, the target predicate should involve some sort of Agent that intends that the benefit go to the Beneficiary.
attributes.instrument: An entity directed by the Signatory that interacts with the Agreement document so as to produce the Signature.
attributes.agreement: The document which encodes the commitment of the Signatory.
attributes.signature: The entity signifying the identity of the Signatory, resulting from the act of writing on the Agreement document.

Commerce_buy(Event).description: A Shopper looks for Goods in order to purchase them.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.co-participant: The Co-participant is an entity that participates in a coordinated way in the shopping event with the Shopper.
attributes.time: When the event occurs.
attributes.shopper: The person who attempts to find the Goods.
attributes.manner: Any description of the purchasing event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Buyer that affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.place: Where the event takes place.
attributes.ground: This is the entity to which the Cognizer pays attention. It is referred to as the Ground because it serves as the background or context for the Goods. This FE is usually expressed as a preposition phrase.
attributes.means: The Means by which a commercial transaction occurs.
attributes.outcome: The failure or success of an attempt.
attributes.goods: The FE Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction.
attributes.degree: This FE identifies the amount of effort put into shopping.
attributes.depictive: This FE describes a participant of shopping scenario as being in some state during the action.
attributes.purpose: The Purpose for which an intentional act is performed.
attributes.buyer: The Buyer wants the Goods and offers Money to a Seller in exchange for them.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation for which an event occurs.
attributes.money: Money is the thing given in exchange for Goods in a transaction.
attributes.period_of_iterations: The length of time from when the commerce event began to be repeated to when it stopped.
attributes.recipient: The individual intended by the Buyer to receive the Goods.
attributes.unit: This FE is any unit in which goods or services can be measured.
attributes.seller: The Seller has possession of the Goods and exchanges them for Money from a Buyer.
attributes.imposed_purpose: The Buyer's intended purpose for the Goods.
attributes.rate: In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods.

Imposing_obligation(Event).description: A Duty is imposed on a Responsible_party according to a Principle which regulates how the Responsible_party should respond to a Situation.  The Situation may be expressed metonymically by reference to an Obligator, whose action invokes the Principle.  It is only rarely the case that the Principle and the Situation/Obligator are both expressed overtly.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.purpose: The state-of-affairs that the Obligator hopes to bring about by imposing the obligation.
attributes.condition: This FE indicates the Conditions under which the Responsible_party is obligated to perform the Duty .
attributes.duty: The action that the Responsible_party is obligated to perform.
attributes.means: An event which brings about the obligation.
attributes.responsible_party: The person who must perform the Duty.
attributes.place: A location in which the Responsible_party has a specified Duty .
attributes.situation: A state of affairs that results in the Responsible_party being obligated to carry out the Duty in accordance with the Principle.
attributes.principle: A regulating idea  (which may be instantiated as a document)  that the Responsible_party is subject to.
attributes.obligator: The Obligator is the person who imposes the Duty on the Responsible_party.
attributes.time: The time interval during which  the Duty is imposed on the Responsible_party  by the Obligator or the Situation.
attributes.manner: Any holistic description of the details of the action, either comparing to another event or describing the action in terms of characteristics of the Obligator that affect the action holistically.

Rewards_and_punishments(Event).description: The Payer is (legally) forced to pay a Fine by an official Speaker as a punishment for some action (the Reason).  The Speaker represents an entity which receives the payment.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.fine: The money given to expiate some debt for transgression.
attributes.time: When the event occurs.
attributes.means: The action that is taken that results in punishement/reward.
attributes.event: The imposition of a debt due to culpable behavior.
attributes.purpose: The purpose for which an intentional act is performed.
attributes.payer: The Payer is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment is made.  With verbs this FE is typically expressed as Object:
attributes.instrument: The instrument with which an intentional act is performed.
attributes.speaker: The Speaker is the person who imposes the Fine upon the Payer.
attributes.result: Result of an event
attributes.rate: In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods.
attributes.manner: Manner of performing an action
attributes.reason: Typically, there is a constituent expressing the Reason for the Judge's judgment. It is usually a for-PP, e.g.
attributes.degree: Degree to which event occurs
attributes.place: Where the event takes place.
attributes.unit: This FE is any Unit in which goods or services can be measured.
attributes.execution: The punishment of death given to the Executed by the Executioner.
attributes.executed: The Executed is the person who is killed by the Executioner in retribution for the crime that the Executed was convicted of.
attributes.explanation: Often, there is a constituent expressing the Explanation for the Judge's judgment which the Executioner is carrying out. It is usually a for-PP.
attributes.executioner: The Executioner is the individual who performs the execution.
attributes.depictive: Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action
attributes.response_action: The reward or punishment given to the Evaluee by the Agent.
attributes.agent: The Agent is the person performing the intentional act.
attributes.evaluee: Evaluee is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment is made. With verbs this FE is typically expressed as Object:
attributes.body_part: This FE is the location on the body where the bodily injury takes place.
attributes.severity: This frame element marks a quantity related to the seriousness of the punished behavior.

Institutionalization(Event).description: A Patient is committed to the care of a medical Facility by a proper Authority. Regardless of whether the Patient agrees or does not agree with their placement in the Facility, the Authority judges that it is in the best interest of the Patient or his environment that the Patient receive treatment in the Facility.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.time: The time interval during which the institutionalization happens.
attributes.depictive: This FE describes a participant of the institutionalization as being in some state during the action.
attributes.place: The location in which the Facility is situated.
attributes.patient: The person who is committed to a facility with a view towards helping them mentally or physically.
attributes.frequency: This FE marks the amount of times the Patient is committed to the Facility per unit of time.
attributes.purpose: The purpose of the institutionalization.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.
attributes.affliction: The condition exhibited by the Patient, which is deemed to merit institutionalization by the Authority.
attributes.facility: The facility where the Patient is taken for treatment.
attributes.authority: The Authority is the actor carrying out the institutionalization with proper legal authorization, either invested into them in general by the government or granted due to power of attorney over the Patient.
attributes.duration_of_final_state: This FE identifies the length of the time period for which the Authority has placed  the Patient in the Facility.
attributes.means: An intentional action performed by the Authority that brings about the institutionalization of the Patient.
attributes.manner: Any description of the institutionalization event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Authority that affect the action (ruthlessly).
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the occurrence of the  institutionalization event logically follows.

Testing(Event).description: A Tester uses a concrete or conceptual Product in order to determine either whether it works or to find out how well or in which manner it works. The Tester may have particular Unwanted_characteristics in mind that they are specifically looking for. The operational test may also be carried out under a particular set of Circumstances that are typically relevant to the functioning of the Product.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.product: The entity that the Tester uses  to ascertain whether it is intact.
attributes.tester: The person who uses  the Product to see if it is intact or to ascertain its characteristics during operation.
attributes.time: The Time when the Tester uses  the Product to evaluate its functioning.
attributes.unwanted_characteristics: An entity or property whose presence would impair the acceptability or usefulness of the Product.
attributes.means: This FE is used for a Means action which the Tester   carries out in testing the Product.
attributes.location_of_protagonist: This FE is the position of the Tester during the act of testing.  Typically, it is expressed in a from-PP.
attributes.result: The Result of the Operational_testing.
attributes.place: The location in which the test is carried out.
attributes.desired_state_of_affairs: The desirable state of affairs which the Tester hopes to find to obtain when using the Product.
attributes.circumstances: The FE Circumstances is used for circumstances that obtain during the test procedure. These are typically relevant to how the Product functions.
attributes.tested_property: A variable of behavior of the Product which is specifically evaluated.
attributes.period_of_iterations: The length of time from when the testing event began to be repeated to when it stopped.
attributes.duration: The length of the time period during which the Tester continuously or repeatedly operates the Product to determine its operational characteristics.
attributes.degree: This FE identifies the extent  to which the Tester examines the Product.
attributes.function: A  use to which the Product is put .
attributes.manner: This FE identifies the Manner in which the Tester uses the Product in order to evaluate its functioning.
attributes.purpose: An action that the Tester intends to accomplish subjecting the Product to a test of its functioning.

Examination(Event).description: This frame deals with testing or examination of someone's Knowledge or skill in a particular area.  An Examiner conducts an Examination to an Examinee to determine the Examinee's Knowledge and/or determine their Qualification for some privilege; this proceeds either by the Examinee demonstrating a skill or by writing responses to questions.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.means: An act whereby the Examiner assesses the Examinee.
attributes.examiner: One who administers a test of some kind.The teacher tested the students.
attributes.purpose: The state-of-affairs that the Examiner wants to bring about by giving the Examinee the Examination.
attributes.knowledge: The ability, practice, or command of information on which an Examinee is tested.
attributes.examinee: One who undergoes a test of some kind.The students took a test.
attributes.manner: Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Examiner that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.place: The location where the examination takes place.
attributes.time: The time at which the examination occurs.
attributes.examination: The Examination that somebody takes.The examination tests driving skills.
attributes.qualification: A credential or status that one acquires by passing an Examination.He took the college entrance exam.

Ingestion(Event).description: An Ingestor consumes food or drink (Ingestibles), which entails putting the Ingestibles in the mouth for delivery to the digestive system.  This may include the use of an Instrument.  Sentences that describe the provision of food to others are NOT included in this frame.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.time: The Time at which the Ingestor ingests the Substance.
attributes.source: Place from which the Ingestor takes the Ingestibles
attributes.manner: The Manner in which the Ingestor ingests the Substance.
attributes.instrument: The Instrument with which an intentional act is performed.
attributes.place: The Place where the Ingestor ingests the Substance.
attributes.means: The Means by which the Ingestor ingests the Substance.
attributes.ingestibles: The Ingestibles are the entities that are being consumed by the Ingestor.
attributes.purpose: The Purpose for which the Ingestor ingests the Substance.
attributes.degree: The extent to which the Ingestibles are consumed by the Ingestor.
attributes.duration: The Duration is the length of time for which the Ingestor ingests.
attributes.substance: The Substance is the drug or other substance that is ingested by the Ingestor.
attributes.frequency: The Frequency with which the Ingestor ingests.
attributes.delivery_device: The Delivery_device is the means by which the Substance is ingested.  Tabitha smoked a pipe.  Simon  smoked  pot with a bong.
attributes.entry_path: The Entry_path is the path along which the Substance enters the Ingestor's body.  Rick snorted cocaine up his nose.

Labeling(Event).description: A Speaker uses as a Label to refer to an Entity. The Label is not a conventional name for the Entity but a description categorizing the Entity and thereby  expressing a judgment.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.entity: The concrete or abstract thing with which the Speaker has associated a particular linguistic sign.
attributes.place: A physical space whose occupants use the Label to refer to the Entity.
attributes.label: The linguistic sign that the Speaker uses to designate the Entity.
attributes.medium: A text whose author applies a particular Label to an Entity.
attributes.particular_iteration: Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
attributes.duration_of_final_state: Duration_of_final_state denotes the length of time from the beginning of a state resulting from the activity denoted by the target until the state no longer holds.
attributes.time: A time period in which a Speaker uses the Label.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows.
attributes.speaker: The Speaker is the person who conventionally uses a linguistic sign to refer to an Entity.

Kidnapping(Event).description: The words in this frame describe situations in which a Perpetrator carries off and holds the Victim against his or her will by force.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.place: Where the kidnapping takes place.
attributes.frequency: The number of times that the Victim is kidnapped.
attributes.degree: Degree to which event occurs
attributes.goal: Goal is the place in which the Victim ends up.
attributes.duration: The period of time for which the Victim is held by the Perpetrator
attributes.event: The abduction of a Victim by a Perpetrator.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation expresses why the Perpetrator commits the kidnapping.
attributes.purpose: The Purpose is what the Perpetrator hopes to accomplish by kidnapping.
attributes.time: When the kidnapping occurs.
attributes.victim: The Victim is the person who is carried off and held against his/her will.
attributes.manner: Manner in which the kidnapping takes place.
attributes.co-participant: An additional abductee taken along with the Victim.
attributes.source: Source is the initial location of the Victim before it changes location.
attributes.perpetrator: The Perpetrator is the person (or other agent) who carries off and holds the Victim against his or her will.
attributes.means: An act performed by the Perpetrator that helps them accomplish the kidnapping.

Submitting_documents(Event).description: A Submittor gives Documents to an Authority so that they can be processed as part of an application, evaluation or other official or bureaucratic process.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.place: The Place where the Submittor gives the Documents to the Authority.
attributes.time: The time period during which the Submittor gives the Documents to the Authority.
attributes.authority: The individual or organization that ends up in possession of the Documents and processes them.
attributes.means: The Means by which the Submittor gives the Documents to the Authority.
attributes.beneficiary: This extra-thematic FE applies to participants that derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate. Further, the target predicate should involve some sort of agent that intends that the benefit go to the Beneficiary.
attributes.depictive: This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. The depicted state does not necessarily or usually facilitate or cause the state of affairs reported by the target.
attributes.documents: The artifacts containing content, typically in the form of text and images, that the Submittor gives to the Authority.
attributes.manner: The Manner is the manner in which the Submittor gives the Documents to the Authority.
attributes.explanation: The Explanation denotes a proposition from which event of the Submittor's giving the Documents to the Authority logically follows.
attributes.imposed_purpose: The Authority's intended purpose for the Documents.
attributes.purpose: The Purpose for which the Submittor gives the Documents to the Authority.
attributes.submittor: The person that begins in possession of the Documents and gives them over into the possession of the Authority for processing.  The Human Services financial worker cannot decide if you will get food support benefits until you turn in the form and needed verifications.

Prison(Event).description: This Frame deals with Penal_institutions. They are run by an Operator and may be intended to hold certain kinds of Inmates.  Penal_institutions may have a special Name and their Location may also be indicated.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.inmates: Inmates marks expressions that indicate the group of people a Penal Institution is intended to hold.
attributes.penal_institution: The locale which serves to confine individuals, generally for the purpose of punishment. This FE is incorporated in each LU in this frame.
attributes.location: This FE marks expressions that indicate the Location of the Penal Institution.
attributes.name: This FE marks expressions that are the Name of a Penal Institution.
attributes.security: The level of security maintained at the prison.
attributes.descriptor: This FE is used to describe a salent characteristic of the Penal_institution not otherwise specified.
attributes.operator: The Frame Element Operator marks expressions that indicate which level of government operates the Penal Institution.

Justifying(Event).description: An Agent has done or omitted to do an Act or is responsible for the obtaining of a State_of_affairs, which a Judge deems to constitute a violation of an obligation or a moral guideline. The Agent gives a Reason why the Act or omission or State_of_affairs was licit despite appearances.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.state_of_affairs: A State_of_affairs that the Agent is held responsible for.
attributes.means: An intentional action, typically an act of speaking, which the Agent performs in order to justify an Act or State_of_affairs.
attributes.act: An action  for which the Agent is held responsible, frequently one that the Agent has taken themself.
attributes.degree: The extent to which the justification was adequate.
attributes.agent: The person or organization that  is held responsible for a prior Act or for a State_of_affairs.
attributes.explanation: The set of facts or circumstances that the Agent offers in explanation of their earlier Act or of the State_of_affairs
attributes.judge: The person or institution that holds the Agent responsible for an Act or State_of_affairs.
attributes.time: The Time of the justifying event.
attributes.frequency: This FE denotes the number of times the Act or State_of_affairs are justified.
attributes.domain: The general spectrum of reasoning that the Agent uses to explain the Act or State_of_affairs.

Emergency(Event).description: This frame characterizes the situation or state of affairs in which someone should or must act to prevent a Undesirable_event from occurring. Often, an Entity affected by the Undesirable_event is more salient than the event itself and is mentioned in its place.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.manner: Any description of the Emergency_fire event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (loudly, urgently), and general descriptions comparing events.
attributes.timespan: The period within which an Emergency has occurred.
attributes.entity: The individual or valued object that is threatened by a worsening condition.
attributes.undesirable_event: The potentially damaging event that should be prevented or ameliorated.
attributes.experiencer: This FE identifies the experiencer within the emergency action chain, often relating the person or group who feels or is threatened by the emergency.
attributes.frequency: How often the Emergency occurs.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the Place where the Fire is burning.
attributes.duration: How long the Emergency takes place.
attributes.domain: The domain of the situation which the emergency is affecting.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the Time when the Fire is burning.
attributes.circumstances: The conditions in which the Undesirable_event occurs; or, the circumstances that explain the impending threat to the Entity.
attributes.name: Name given to the burning Emergency_fire
attributes.fire: The total material currently involved in combustion, including both the parts of the Fuel currently undergoing chemical alteration and the partially ionized gas that results from this process.
attributes.fuel: The entity that is undergoing rapid chemical alteration leading to damage or destruction.

Terrorism(Event).description: A Terrorist commits a violent or otherwise harmful Act upon a Victim in order to coerce or terrorize a government or populace. The Act may be committed in particular for political or ideological reasons, and is often directed at civilians, as opposed to government or military officials. It is most often in violation of one or many laws.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.organization: A Terrorist may be part of a larger group or Organization of such people.
attributes.purpose: The action or state-of-affairs that the Terrorist is trying to accomplish by commiting the Act.
attributes.manner: The Manner in which the Terrorist commits the Act.
attributes.instrument: The Instrument is used by the Terrorist in order to inflict harm or commit the Act.
attributes.terrorist: The Terrorist commits the Act of terror for political or ideological gains.
attributes.victim: The Victim is most directly affected or harmed by the Act of terrorism.
attributes.place: The location where the Act takes place.
attributes.act: The Act is the harmful action performed by the Terrorist or terrorist organization.
attributes.descriptor: Any characterization or evaluation of the Terrorist or Act.
attributes.means: The intermediate action performed by the Terrorist in order to comit the Act.
attributes.time: The location in time when the Act takes place.

Vocalizations(Event).description: This frame is concerned with the sounds produced by animate entities by means of their vocal tracts. Descriptions of sounds from artifacts meant to emulate such sounds, or to act as vocalizing animals or people, are also treated here as figurative language.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.manner: Certain properties of the sound relating to its production, loudness, etc  may be of lexicographic interest if they describe properties of a sounds as such: loudly, shrilly, etc.
attributes.location_of_sound_source: The place from which the sound emanates.
attributes.place: The location at which sound is produced. This FE differs from Location_of_sound_source in that it does not highlight the sound's spreading from its source to the perceiver's location, which is usually indicated by the preposition "from".
attributes.degree: Expressions that indicate the loudness of the sound.
attributes.path: The Path along which the sound travels away from the Sound_source.
attributes.explanation: This FE idntifies the Explanation that the Sound_source produces the sound. Generally, this is some external stimulus that prompts the Sound_source to make noise.
attributes.sound_source: An entity that is construed as a single point source emitting sound.
attributes.frequency: How often the Vocalization event occurs.
attributes.internal_cause: The noise-making may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an Internal_cause,  that is the mental or emotional state of an animate Sound_source.

Risk(Event).description: An Agent performs some Action which is considered imprudent.  This frame is distinct from Attempt in that the danger that the Agent puts themselves in by performing the Action is profiled.  The danger is not spelled out, but generally the Action has a possibility or likelihood of causing social or physical harm to the Agent.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.purpose: The purpose for which the Action is performed.
attributes.place: The location where the Agent risks doing the Action.
attributes.time: The time at which the Agent dares to perform the Action.
attributes.action: This FE denotes the Action taken by the Agent.
attributes.manner: Any description of the risking action which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.explanation: The Explanation the Agent takes the risk.
attributes.agent: The individual that performs the Action, resulting in danger to themself.

Resolve_problem(Event).description: An Agent resolves an outstanding Problem by finding its solution, explanation, answer, etc.  Alternatively, some non-agentive Cause may resolve the Problem.  The Means, Degree, Time and Place may also be expressed.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.means: The Means is an intermediate action taken by the Agent in order to resolve the Problem.
attributes.purpose: The state of affairs that the Agent is trying to bring about by solving the Problem in the specified way.
attributes.place: This FE indicates the location at which the Problem is resolved.
attributes.co-participant: A person who participates in resolving a Problem along with the Agent.
attributes.containing_event: The Containing_event denotes an event or state of affairs that occurs or holds at a time that includes the time during which the resolution of the Problem occurs.
attributes.time: This FE indicates the Time at which the Problem is resolved.
attributes.circumstances: Some specification of the circumstances under which the Problem is resolved.
attributes.agent: The Agent finds the solution or explanation to the outstanding mystery or Problem.
attributes.degree: The Degree to which the Agent or Cause resolves the problem.
attributes.instrument: The Instrument is an entity used for resolving the Problem .
attributes.resultant_situation: The Resultant_situation is any situation which arises as a result of resolving a Problem .
attributes.problem: The Problem is the predicament or mystery that is resolved.
attributes.manner: Any description of the resolution, such as secondary effects ( quietly ) or comparisons of events ( the same way ).  In agentive cases,  Manner may also describe salient characteristics of the Agent which affect the action.
attributes.beneficiary: This FE applies to participants that derive a benefit from the resolution of a Problem .
attributes.role: Role is used for the capacity in which the Agent resolves a Problem or the role of the Problem in being resolved, and is expressed in as-PPs.
attributes.cause: The Cause is the non-Agentive event or state of affairs that brings about the resolution of the Problem.
attributes.frequency: Frequency describes how often the Agent or Cause resolves this problem.
attributes.duration: This FE identifies the length of time taken to resolve a Problem .
attributes.medium: This FE identifies the physical or abstract setting in which the Problem is resolved.
attributes.outcome: The Outcome is the failure or success of resolving a Problem .

Revenge(Event).description: This frame concerns the infliction of punishment in return for a wrong suffered. An Avenger performs a Punishment on a Offender as a consequence of an earlier action by the Offender, the Injury. The Avenger inflicting thePunishment need not be the same as the Injured_Party who suffered the Injury,  but the Avenger does have to share the judgment that the Offender's action was wrong. The judgment that the Offender had inflicted an Injury  is made without regard to the law.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the Time when the revenge occurs.
attributes.depictive: Depictive identifies a phrase describing the actor of an action.
attributes.avenger: The Avenger exacts revenge from the Offender for the Injury.
attributes.injury: The Injury is the injurious action committed by the Offender against the Injured_Party. This Frame Element need not always be realized, although it is conceptually necessary.
attributes.result: This FE identifies the Result of  inflicting punishment for a wrong suffered.
attributes.punishment: The Avenger carries out a Punishment in order to exact revenge on the Offender.
attributes.instrument: This FE identifies the Instrument with which the revenge is performed.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the Purpose for which the revenge is performed.
attributes.manner: This frame element refers to the Manner in which the Avenger exacts their revenge from the Offender.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the Place where the revenge occurs.
attributes.duration: The length of time that the Avenger seeks revenge for the Injury.
attributes.degree: This FE identifies the Degree to which an event occurs.
attributes.offender: The Offender has committed the earlier Injury for which the Avenger seeks revenge.
attributes.injured_party: This frame element identifies the constituent that encodes who or what suffered the Injury at the hands of the Offender. Sometimes, an abstract concept such a person's honour or their blood is presented as the element that has suffered the Injury. These also constitute instances of  Injured_party

Limiting(Event).description: An Agent or Cause limits a Range_of_options to having a certain Characteristic. The Characteristic may be that only certain types of the Range_of_options may be acceptable, or (in the case of a plural or mass Range_of_options) that only certain cardinalities or quanties are acceptable. Alternatively, the Degree to which the Range_of_options is limited may be mentioned.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.purpose: The purpose for which the Agent or Cause limits the Range_of_options.
attributes.characteristic: The Characteristic indicates the subtypes or situations to which the Range_of_options is limited.
attributes.range_of_options: The Range_of_options would normally be expected to have a set of possibilites, but is limited by an Agent or Cause to particular subtypes, situations or characteristics.
attributes.degree: The Degree to which the Entity is limited.
attributes.time: The time at which the limiting takes place.
attributes.cause: The Cause is a natural occurrence or state-of-affairs that limits the Range_of_options.
attributes.manner: The way in which the Agent of Cause limits the Range_of_options.
attributes.agent: The Agent consciously places limits upon the Range_of_options.
attributes.means: An act performed by the Agent or Cause that accomplishes the action indicated by the target.
attributes.duration: The length of time over which the Range_of_options is limited.
attributes.place: The location in which the Agent or Cause limits the Range_of_options.
attributes.entity: The Entity would normally be expected to have a set of possibilites, but instead exhibits only certain possibilites, or exhibits them on fewer situations than expected.

Research(Event).description: An Experimenter conducts an Experiment based on a Hypothesis.  This Experiment contains a Control_group or Control_group_member which is compared with a Treatment_group or Treated_individual in order to determine the Result.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.place: The physical place where the research is carried out.
attributes.duration: The amount of time the Experiment lasts.
attributes.control_group: The group of entities in the Experiment which have not been treated and are compared to the Treatment_group or Treated_individual.
attributes.treated_individual: An individual subject that receives treatment and is then compared to the Control_group or Controlled_individual.
attributes.control_group_member: An individual entity of the Experiment which is left untreated and then compared with the Treatment_group or the Treated_individual.
attributes.subjects: In this frame Control_group and Treatment_group can be combined and expressed as Subjects.  This FE can also be used for a generic individual on whom the Experiment is being conducted (see second example).
attributes.result: The Result depicts the outcome of the Experiment.
attributes.descriptor: A Descriptor identifies a characteristic or description of the Experiment or the Subjects not captured by any other frame element.
attributes.phenomenon: A property that belongs to either the Control_group or the Treatment_group.  Usually expressed by a PP.
attributes.time: The time when  the research is carried out.
attributes.treatment_group: A group of subjects that receive Treatment and are compared to the Control_group or Controlled_individuals.
attributes.instrument: A tool used in conducting the Experiment.  Usually expressed by a with-PP.
attributes.topic: A phenomenon or idea involved in a Question.
attributes.experiment: The test or Experiment conducted by the Experimenter using a Control_group and a Treatment_group.
attributes.hypothesis: The Hypothesis is a conjecture as to the result of an Experiment.  The Experiment takes place in order to prove the Hypothesis as correct or incorrect.
attributes.experimenter: The Experimenter is the individual conducting the Experiment.
attributes.manner: Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously),  general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of the Researcher that also affect the action (deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
attributes.duration_of_state: The Duration_of_state is the period of time over which the research takes place.
attributes.researcher: The people engaged in a research endeavor.
attributes.purpose: Purpose indicates an action that the Researcher intends to accomplish by performing research.
attributes.means: The experimentations, observations, or other procedures performed by the Researcher in order to find an answer to the Question.
attributes.population: A group of entities that are studied by the Researcher to answer the Question. The studied group need not be the only kind of entity that provides evidence for answering the research Question.
attributes.type: The Type, or subclass of research.
attributes.question: A significant unanswered open proposition which the Researcher is attempting to resolve.

Having_or_lacking_access(Event).description: A Theme has access to a Useful_location or is blocked from it by a Barrier.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.barrier: An entity, event, or state that (at least potentially) prevents the Theme from getting to the Useful_location.
attributes.explanation: An Explanation for why the Barrier exists, or for why the Theme meets or fails to meet pre-conditions for entering the Useful_location.
attributes.circumstances: The Circumstances under which the Theme meets or fails to meet the pre-conditions for getting to the Useful_location.
attributes.degree: The extent to which the Theme exceeds or falls short of the ability to move to the Useful_location
attributes.useful_location: The place or thing that the Theme is headed towards, despite a potential or actual Barrier.
attributes.theme: The Theme whose motion is blocked or free.

Theft(Event).description: These are words describing situations in which a Perpetrator takes Goods from a  Victim or a Source. The Means by which this is accomplished may also be expressed.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.instrument: An object used by the Perpetrator in taking possession of the Goods.
attributes.frequency: The number of times that a theft occurs.
attributes.manner: This FE identifies the Manner in which the theft occurs.
attributes.purpose: This FE identifies the Purpose for which a theft occurs.
attributes.victim: Victim is the person (or other sentient being or group) that owns the goods before they are taken away by the perpetrator.
attributes.explanation: This FE identifies the Explanation for why a theft occurs.
attributes.goods: Goods is anything (including labor, time, or legal rights) that can be taken away.
attributes.means: This FE identifies the Means by which a Perpetrator takes the Victim's Goods.
attributes.place: This FE identifies the Place where the theft occurs.
attributes.time: This FE identifies the Time when the theft occurs.
attributes.perpetrator: Perpetrator is the person (or other agent) that takes the goods away.
attributes.source: Source is the initial location of the goods, before they change location.

Incident(Event).description: A State_of_affairs (a state or event) either holds or occurs, and is presented as being causally independent of other (implicit) states or events that might otherwise have been expected to be causally related to the State_of_affairs. The Time or Place may also be mentioned.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.time: The Time at which the State_of_affairs holds.
attributes.manner: Any description of the target word not covered by a more specific FE.
attributes.place: The Place where the State_of_affairs holds.
attributes.state_of_affairs: A State_of_affairs (that is, an event or state) that holds independently of (potentially) causally-related States of affairs.

Award(Event).description: The existence of a State_of_affairs is sufficient reason for taking an Action . The agent who is justified in taking the suggested Action is not part of the immediate scene, however.

attributes.mention: The text span that triggers the event.
attributes.state_of_affairs: An Eventuality or an Entity that is taken to constitute sufficient reason for taking another Action.
attributes.degree: How sufficiently State_of_affairs can be considered a reason for the Action.
attributes.action: An Action that is taken to be justifiable given the State_of_Affairs.
attributes.domain: The general spectrum of reasoning along which the State_of_affairs is a justification.
attributes.circumstances: Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the Deserving event and any of its participants.
